Title: Will decide larger issue of women’s entry into religious places: Nine-judge SC bench
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

NEW DELHI: A nine-judge bench of the Supreme Court on Monday said it will only examine the larger issue of faith-based customs violating fundamental rights of women and lay down guidelines for judicial scrutiny of petitions raising issues relating to clash of faith with fundamental rights.

The important clarification means the bench will not pronounce on petitions seeking a review of the SC’s order overturning the Sabarimala shrine’s tradition of not permitting the entry of female worshippers in the 10-50 year (menstruating age) group that had led to widespread protests in Kerala.

The bench of Chief Justice S A Bobde and Justices R Banumathi, Ashok Bhushan, L Nageswara Rao, M M Shantanagoudar, S Abdul Nazeer, R Subhash Reddy, B R Gavai and Surya Kant said it will decide the larger issue and not hear arguments on pleas challenging SC’s September 28, 2018, judgment quashing the ban on entry of women in the specified age group, a tradition based on the presiding deity Ayyappa being a “naishtik brahmachari”.

On November 14 last year, a five-judge bench led by then CJI Ranjan Gogoi by three to two majority had not disturbed the September 28 judgment allowing the entry of women of all ages but asked a seven-judge bench to evolve guidelines for deciding cases involving clash of fundamental rights and faith emerging from women’s entry to temples, mosques and agiyaris. CJI Bobde decided to constitute a nine-judge bench for the purpose.

In the meanwhile, the Left-led Kerala government’s enthusiasm for implementing the SC order has also waned after it suffered a rout in the Lok Sabha elections. Thereafter, the government has stopped enforcing the SC order taking the view that it will be guided by law and order considerations.

The SC on November 14 had said reference of the issue to a seven-judge bench was needed as the possibility of a clash between faith and fundamental rights emerged not only in the Sabarimala case but also in pending petitions “regarding entry of Muslim women in dargah/mosque, Parsi women married to non-Parsi men into agiyari and practice of female genital mutilation (FGN) among Dawoodi Bohras”.

The nine-judge bench led by CJI Bobde brushed aside strenuous arguments from Indira Jaising that the court should not decide any issue other than the Sabarimala temple entry case as no other petitions were placed before the larger bench. “Personal laws for Hindus, Muslims and Parsis are governed by three different regimes. The issues pertaining to Islam and Parsis are not before the court,” she said.

The bench said it would call for hearing the petitions raising issues relating to entry of women into mosques and agiyaris. Encouraged, senior advocate Vikas Singh said the court should also include Ashwini Upadhyay’s PIL challenging the validity of ‘nikah halala’ and polygamy among Muslims. The bench refused to include ‘nikah halala’ and polygamy among a section of Muslims in its scrutiny.

The SC said individual issues — entry of women into Sabarimala, mosques and agiyaris as well as FGN — would be decided by smaller benches on the basis of guidelines, which would be devised by the nine-judge bench after hearing all parties.

Solicitor general Tushar Mehta pleaded the nine-judge bench should go strictly by the reference order of the five-judge bench and not include additional issues like ‘nikah halala’ and polygamy. Though the bench was ready to commence hearing, senior advocate A M Singhvi requested it to give the counsel three weeks to prepare written submissions on the larger issue. The bench agreed to give three weeks to counsel to hold meetings among themselves for finalisation of issues to be dealt with by the court.

Senior advocate Rajeev Dhavan intervened and said it was not the task of the SC to tell people what constituted essential religious practice in their religion.

Title: Property dealer shot in Patna City
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

Representative image

PATNA: Close on the heels of a medicine trader’s murder, a 45-year-old property dealer, Ramashish Singh, was shot dead by armed criminals over a property dispute at Mirchi village under the Bypass police station area in Patna City sub-division late on Sunday night.

Police said a group of armed criminals attacked Singh while he was returning home from Patna on a motorcycle around 10.30pm. Singh was rushed to the Nalanda Medical College and Hospital (NMCH) where he died during treatment late in the night.

SHO of Bypass police station Ajay Kumar said on Monday that Singh was intercepted by the criminals at a stone’s throw distance from his house on Mirchi-Marcha road. “Locals as well as family members of Singh rushed to the spot and took him to the hospital,” the SHO added.

Altogether 15 people, including Puttu Singh, Vijay Singh and Mangal Chand, have been named as accused in the FIR. The SHO said six of the accused have already been arrested and raids were on to nab others.

According to police, Singh also worked for a private insurance company. Sources said Singh’s nephew Upendra Singh alias Upendra Yadav was also killed by criminals in Patna City area on October 2, 2019.

Singh’s relatives said the former had sought police protection apprehending threat to his life. “No action was taken against the people who had threatened him with dire consequences. He was also pursuing the case related to the murder of his nephew in the court,” a close relative of Singh said on the condition of anonymity.

Police said the property dispute between the Singh and his neighbour Ram Ekbal Singh has so far claimed at least four lives. “Land prices at Mirchi village, hardly 3km south of NH-30, have shot up in the past few years. As a result, cases of land dispute have increased in the area,” the police added.

On Saturday night, a veterinary medicine shop owner, Shailendra Kumar Singh (48), was shot dead by a gang of armed criminals at Alamganj in Patna City.

The two murders within 24 hours in Patna City have created panic in the area. “Murders have become a routine affair in Patna City,” said Umesh Kumar, an RJD functionary from the area.

Title: Rain raises temperature, lightning kills Bikaner teen
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

Representative image

JAIPUR: Most places across the state witnessed a sudden change in climatic conditions on Monday with light to moderate showers lashing several areas. Lightning claimed the life of a teenager at Kakda village under Jasrasar police station area of Bikaner district.

The incident took place in Kakda village under Jasrasar police station area. The deceased, who was identified as Ashok Kumar (16), had taken shelter under a tree when it started raining. Kumar suffered severe burn injuries due to lightening and was rushed to a hospital in Nokha where doctors declared him brought dead.

Many places in Barmer, Jodhpur , Pali, Jaisalmer, Bikaner and Hanumangarh witnessed torrential rainfall. People in Hanumangarh and Bikaner witnessed drizzle that continued throughout the day in intervals.

Sriganganagar witnessed a rainfall of 31.4 mm and was followed by Jaisalmer with 13.7 mm, Phalodi (7.6mm) and Bikaner (5.4mm).

Meanwhile, cloudy conditions and increased the humidity guiding the mercury to take an upward swing across the state. People in Jaipur witnessed a minimum temperature of 11.4°C. Throughout the day, cloudy conditions prevailed across the city, but it did not convert into rainfall.

Kota remained coldest recording a minimum temperature of 8.0°C. It was followed by Bikaner at 9.5°C, Sriganganagar (9.9°C), Barmer (10.7°C), Ajmer (12.7°C), Churu (13.5°C)) and Jodhpur (17.5°C).

In its forecast, Jaipur Met office said foggy conditions would be witnessed during early morning hours which would be followed by a clear sky. “The speed of winds would be 18 to 28 km/hour above a height of 500 metres,” said an officer with the Met office.

Many places in the state especially in western Rajasthan also witnessed mild fog which affected the road and rail traffic.

Title: Surat: Newborn was abandoned by parents who wanted girl child
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

Representative image

SURAT: In an interesting case rarely seen in the country, a couple, parents of three boys , who wanted a girl child , abandoned their newborn just because the fourth child too happened to be a boy. However, police were able to locate the parents who had abandoned their newborn baby on January 5, 2020 in the city. The couple was subjected to DNA testing by cops so as to match it with that of the baby to find out if they are the boy’s real parents.

The newborn boy was found in the bushes of Tapi embankment at Vanzara Vas, Tekra Faliya at Singanpore village of Chowk Bazaar on January 5. An offence under IPC section 317 was registered at Chowk Bazaar police station. Police received information about a pregnant woman of Vanzara Vas, who had not been seen for a week before the abandonment of the child.

On Sunday, police approached a couple whom they suspected to have abandoned the baby. Mangu Vanzara, 40, who is a truck driver, and his wife Ganga Vanzara, 30, broke down and accepted that the child was theirs. They admitted to cops that they had abandoned the baby soon after the newborn’s birth on the evening of January 5.

A police officer, who is investigating the case, said, “The couple had abandoned the newborn boy as they wanted a girl child. They were already parents of three boys. Their community regards a girl lucky for the household. They were presented in the court on Sunday and subjected to medical tests. Once the DNA tests of the parents and child match, the newborn will be handed over to them. At present, the child is under the care of child protection agency.”

Title: Lack of funds delays underpass, foot overbridge projects in Patna
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

Representative image

PATNA: The long-pending demand of foot overbridges and underpasses across the city for pedestrian crossing is not likely to be fulfilled soon as the projects have been delayed due to several reasons.

Tenders for foot overbridges at Rupaspur, Rajendra Nagar and in front of Patna zoo and two underpass escalators near Samrat Ashoka Convention Centre were floated by Bihar Rajya Pul Nirman Nigam Limited (BRPNNL) and Bihar State Road Development Corporation Limited (BSRDCL) last year to ease traffic and pedestrian movement across the busy roads. However, due to delay in commencement of work, the projects will take another one year.

BSRDCL managing director Sanjay Kumar Agarwal said the construction work on FoBs will commence in four-five months. “Due to lack of budget last year, the construction work got delayed. However, the expenditure on the FoBs has been included in 2020 Budget,” he said.

Agarwal said work on two foot overbridges to be constructed by the National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) at Anisabad and Mithapur-New Bypass Road will commence this year.

Principal secretary of road construction department (RCD), Amrit Lal Meena, said the foot overbridges and underpasses in the state capital will be constructed soon. “Several measures are being taken in a bid to ensure road safety in the city. The department will soon start construction at all proposed locations,” he said.

An official said tenders for preparing a detailed project report (DPR) of FoB at Rupaspur near the Jagdeo Path-Sheikhpura Mor flyover and another near Rajendra Nagar overbridge were floated last year. “The DPR will be finalized this week. Construction work on both the FoBs will commence simultaneously in a couple of months,” he said.

Meanwhile, pedestrians are often seen facing a tough time while crossing the road at the culmination point of Jagdeo Path-Sheikhpura Mor flyover and Rajendra Nagar overbridge. “The Jagdeo-Path Sheikhpura Mor flyover is one of the busiest flyovers in the city. There’s non-stop vehicular movement on the flyover and underneath it throughout the day and it becomes really difficult to cross the road,” said Simran Singh, who was waiting to cross Bailey Road near Jagdeo Path.

Pedestrians also find it difficult to cross Bailey Road near gate number I of Patna zoo and the Gandhi Maidan-Danapur Road near Samrat Ashok International Convention Centre and SK Memorial Hall where government and non-government events are organized regularly. Two underpass escalators near the convention centre were scheduled to be constructed by March this year. “The road in front of Bapu Sabhagar is dangerous for pedestrians to cross,” said Vikas Kumar, a resident of Ashok Rajpath.

Title: Love affair results in murder of 23-year-old man in Surat
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

Representative image

SURAT: Akash Jaiswal , 23, was brutally stabbed to death by four persons in his flat in Dindoli area of the city on Monday. Police have identified all the assailants and said the victim’s alleged love affair with the sister of the main accused had led to his murder .

Dindoli police said Jaiswal was in his house at Royal Star Apartment when the four persons, including a woman, barged in and stabbed him five times in his throat, chest and other parts of the body. Jaiswal died on the spot and the assailants fled from the spot.

The attackers were Shubham Prakah Devde, a salesman and brother of the girl with whom Jaiswal had an affair; Shubham’s mother Mangala, a casual worker; Shubham’s cousin Narendra Sonwane, a textile worker; and Shubham’s friend Utkarsh Yadav, also a salesman in a shop. The victim and assailants lived in the same apartment, police said.

“Family members of the girl believed that Akash had lured her into having an affair with him. They wanted to teach him a lesson. Love affair was the reason for the murder,” said an officer of Dindoli police station.

The victim was allegedly caught for bootlegging in the past and a few offences were registered against him in this connection, police said. They said, “All the accused will be caught soon.”

Title: Intense campaign blunts kite manja’s sharpness in Surat
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

Kite flying is at peak during Uttarayan and two days after January 14 in the city

SURAT: Large-scale campaigns run by people to save birds during Uttarayan have begun to yield results in the city. NGOs and Surat Nursing Association say calls for rescue of birds that had reduced nearly by half last year have further decreased in 2020. Similarly, number of injuries to humans by kite manja too have reduced by half.

Kite flying is at peak during Uttarayan and two days after January 14 in the city. Every weekend of January before Uttarayan, people in large number fly kites which injure birds.

“Birds fly out of their nests in the early morning and evening hours and this proves fatal for many of them as people would be flying kites then,” said Darshan Desai, a volunteer of Prayas, an NGO which workers for the welfare of the birds.

“We started a campaign a few years ago and asked people, especially school students, not to fly kites in the early morning and evening hours for the safety of birds. A large number of school students have taken oaths not to fly kites. The result is we received nearly 50 per cent less calls of bird injuries than we had received in 2018.”

Suman Desai, a young graduate from Vesu, said, “I was crazy about kites. When I was in school I used to spend at least an hour on my terrace after Diwali until Uttarayan just flying kites. However, fatal injury to a dove due to the manja of my kite made me restrain my passion. Now I don’t fly kites.”

Surat Nursing Association started its helpline for birds and humans on Monday. SNA president Iqbal Kadiwala said, “We have treated just four humans this year against 12 two days before Uttarayan last year. Only two calls about injured birds were received by us this year. Younger generation is more into saving lives of birds than flying kites for pleasure.” SNA’s Sahastrafana Charitable Trust has been running a clinic for the birds and humans injured by manja for the past 13 years.

Title: No intent to defame: Tata; Nusli Wadia drops suits
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

Nusli Wadia (File photo)

NEW DELHI: Tata Sons chairman emeritus Ratan Tata’s conciliatory statement that he had “no intention to defame” industrialist Nusli Wadia saw the latter agree before the Supreme Court on Monday to drop civil and criminal defamation cases he had filed against Tata three years ago.

The court said in its order, “Although Wadia was aggrieved by the statement of Tata, in view of the statement made by Tata that there is no intention to defame Wadia, which is in accordance with the (Bombay) high court’s observations, the petitioner (Wadia) states that he withdraws this petition as well as the civil defamation suit against Tata.”

Wadia had initiated criminal defamation proceedings against Tata and other directors of Tata Group companies after he was ousted as director from Tata Steel, Tata Chemicals and Tata Motors for his support to Cyrus Mistry, who was voted out as executive chairman of Tata Sons in 2016.

Wadia had termed the resolution — purportedly drafted by Tata and others and circulated in the boards of these companies — defamatory as it questioned his bona fide and independence. He had also filed a Rs 3,000-crore civil defamation suit against Tata and others.

On Tata’s plea, the Bombay high court had quashed the criminal defamation proceedings, while recording that there was no intention on Tata’s part to defame Wadia through the contents of the resolutions circulated among the board of directors for his removal.

On January 6, a bench of CJI S A Bobde and Justices B R Gavai and Surya Kant had urged the two top industrialists not to waste time litigating against each other and bury the hatchet. Tata’s counsel A M Singhvi had expressed willingness to make a statement that there was no intention to defame Wadia, as found by Bombay HC, while quashing the criminal defamation case against Tata.

The court had suggested reconciliation between Tata and Wadia while hearing the latter’s appeal against the Bombay HC order. But a counsel’s statement that Wadia would pursue civil defamation case even though he was agreeable to drop the criminal defamation proceedings made the bench adjourn the hearing and ask Wadia’s counsel C A Sundaram to take instructions from his client about withdrawing all defamation cases against Tata.

On Monday, Wadia’s counsel C A Sundaram read out a one-paragraph statement which conveyed that Wadia would drop both criminal and civil defamation proceedings if Tata made a statement that there was no intention to defame him in the 2016 resolutions.

As and when such a statement was made by Tata, Wadia was ready for an amicable settlement of the issue and “shall withdraw the present petition and the civil suit for damages”, Sundaram said. Singhvi said since the HC had already given a finding that there was no intention to defame Wadia, Tata had no reservation to record a statement to that effect before the SC.

Title: Two murders rock Saurashtra, no arrest yet
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

Representative image

RAJKOT: Two murder cases were reported from Ronaj village of Kodinar taluka in Gir Somnath district and Karachaliapara locality of Bhavnagar in the past 24 hours. No accused were arrested in the cases.

In Ronaj village, Ayub Sheikh (45) was stabbed to death by Raghu Dahima on Sunday evening. “Dahima is a bootlegger. Sheikh had asked Dahima to stop the illegal liquor trade in his village and had threatened to approach police, if he did not comply,” said G K Bharwad, inspector with Kodinar police station.

On the fateful day, Sheikh was going on a pilgrimage to a dargah in Velan village of Kodinar taluka. On his way, Dahima allegedly abducted him in a car, killed him and dumped his body by the roadside. Sheikh’s body was later recovered from the outskirts of Pipalva village in Kodinar taluka.

Dahima was booked on the complaint of Sheikh’s son Ebu Sheikh. “There are more persons suspected to be involved in the murder, apart from Dahima. We have launched a manhunt for Dahima,” said Bharwad, adding that Sheikh’s body had been sent for forensic postmortem in GG Hospital in Jamnagar.

The second murder was reported from Karachaliapara locality of Bhavnagar where Pravin Chudasma (35) was stabbed to death by Jiger Bambhania and Kishan Makwana.

According to police, the murder was the result of an altercation that had broken out between Chudasma and Bambhania. On December 31, Bambhania was creating a drunken ruckus. When Chudasma told him to calm down, an altercation broke out between them.

“Nursing a grudge against Chudasma, the accused waylaid him near a water supply plant in Karachaliapara locality and dealt him stabbing wounds. Chudasma was rushed to Sir T Hospital in Bhavnagar where he succumbed to injuries. We have launched a manhunt for Bambhania and Makwana,” said A J Rana, inspector with Bhavnagar C division police station.

Title: Unseasonal rains hit Kutch, Saurashtra
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

Representative image

RAJKOT: Unseasonal rains lashed Saurashtra and Kutch regions once again on Monday. Farmers in the region fear that the unseasonal rains are likely to destroy standing cumin crop.

Showers drenched Rajkot and Junagadh districts too, while in Kutch, Bhuj, Gandhidham, Bhachau and Nakhatrana received rain.

Rain was also experienced in Keshod, Mangrol and Visavadar of Junagadh district. In Gir Somnath district, Veraval got drenched by the unseasonal rains. In Rajkot district, Rajkot city, Dhoraji and Jamkandorana witnessed rains.

In Jamnagar district, rain showers were experienced in Jamjodhpur taluka.

According to India Meteorological Department (IMD), Morning’s induced cyclonic circulation lies over northwest Rajasthan and neighbourhood which is likely to bring rain. Light rain is very likely at isolated places in the district of North Gujarat region namely Banaskantha, Sabarkantha, Patan, Mehsana, Ahmedabad and Gandhinagar, and in Rajkot and Junagadh districts on Tuesday.

Dry weather is likely to prevail in all the districts of south Gujarat region, Kutch district, remaining districts of North Gujarat region, Saurashtra and in Diu, Daman and Dadra Nagar Haveli.

Title: Kolkata: Elderly couple found dead in Narendrapur
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

Representative image

KOLKATA: An elderly couple was found dead inside their Narendrapur apartment on Monday morning. Police suspect the woman, who neighbours and relatives said was bed-ridden, had a natural death while her husband committed suicide in shock. The couple’s relatives said the two of them mostly stayed home ever since their only son drowned some years ago.

The bodies of Tapan Banerjee, 73, and his wife Bakul, 67 — who were former state government employees — have been sent for post-mortem. Cops have, however, ruled out foul play.

Locals said the couple’s maid raised an alarm after receiving no response to repeated knocking. Neighbours informed Narendrapur police, who broke open the door to the Prantik Abasan housing complex flat and found the two dead.

Sovon Roy, a neighbour, said the Banerjees’ maid had served them dinner on Sunday evening before she left for the night. “Bakul was bed-ridden for the past few years. Tapan was also ill and stayed within the complex if he did venture out.

Tapan’s nephew Sudip said, “Once a week, I used to visit my uncle and aunt. They survived on their pensions.”

Sources said the preliminary probe revealed some medicine next to Tapan’s bed, which he was never prescribed. Cops suspect he took them after losing his wife and killed himself. Baruipur SP Indrajit Basu said an investigation has been started.

Title: Upgraded Patna Museum to be magnificent: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

Nitish Kumar

PATNA: Chief minister (CM) Nitish Kumar on Monday said design for extension of Patna Museum has been prepared and bidding process for the construction work has also begun. He said the alignment for an underpass to connect Patna Museum and Bihar Museum will also be finalised soon.

Talking to reporters at his chamber at the state legislative assembly, Nitish said the upgraded and extended Patna Museum will be “magnificent”. “Three additional layers of galleries are being constructed at the back end of the museum. All artefacts kept in the storage of the museum will be displayed in the new galleries,” the CM said.

Sources in art, culture and youth affairs department said apart from extension work, the galleries at the existing building will also be redesigned to give a new look to the museum. Sources in the building construction department, on the other hand, said the new building will be a U-shaped structure, covering the left, right and back side of the existing main structure of the museum.

The new structure will have office space, digital galleries, exhibit area, conference hall, orientation room and space for K P Jayaswal Research Institute. The extension and redevelopment of the museum is proposed to be done with an expenditure of Rs 138 crore.

The existing building of Patna Museum will be used solely for the purpose of display of artefacts. Sources in Patna Museum said only 5% of total artefacts with the museum are on display in the galleries at the main building, while the artefacts of the period before 1765 have been put up at Bihar Museum. Sources said the artefacts in the existing and the extended area of Patna Museum will be put in chronological order, based on the historical era they belong to.

On the tunnel to be constructed for linking Bihar Museum and Patna Museum, the CM said, “The underground tunnel will give a unique experience to the visitors. Its alignment will be finalised soon.”

Sources said the tunnel connecting the two museums will be 1.5km-long. It is proposed to be made ready in two years.

Title: Blackstone to buy majority in Allcargo for Rs 380 crore
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

(File photo)

MUMBAI: Global asset manager Blackstone will buy a majority stake in the warehousing business of Allcargo Logistics , the company said in a regulatory filing on Monday. It will invest Rs 380 crore through equity and debentures in the warehousing unit as it bets on the demand for large storage spaces from e-commerce players like Amazon and Flipkart.

Allcargo, founded by Shashi Kiran Shetty in 1993, will retain a small share in the warehousing business, the company said. The share sale in the warehousing unit follows Allcargo’s proposed buy of a 45% stake in express distribution company Gati for Rs 416 crore.

Blackstone will route the investment in Allcargo’s warehousing business through BRE Asia Urban Holdings. Through the investee company, Blackstone plans to develop industrial and logistics parks in key Indian markets. The introduction of a single indirect tax — goods and services tax — for the whole nation has also boosted demand for warehouses from consumer-focused companies to ensure speedy and last-mile conveyance of products.

The transaction, said Allcargo, will be completed over 12 months and will be subject to the achievement of certain business performance milestones prescribed in the documents executed by Blackstone.

Allcargo’s stock closed at Rs 104 a share, up over 4% on the BSE in a strong Monday market. The warehousing unit plans to develop 3 million sqft of storage centres in the country, which will ramp up its existing portfolio of 6 million sqft of logistics parks. “The Indian warehousing sector is on an expansionary curve backed by a robust regulatory environment and the government’s thrust in boosting manufacturing, e-commerce and organised retail. The industry has emerged as an attractive investment destination for global investors,” said Shashi Kiran Shetty, chairman of the Rs 6,800-crore-plus Allcargo Logistics.

Private equity funds have invested more than $1 billion in warehousing units in India in the last three years compared to zero investment in 2015 and 2016 combined. Recently, Adani announced the purchase of 40% in Snowman Logistics for Rs 296 crore.

Title: Will talk to Union IT minister Ravi Shankar Prasad for ban on porn sites, says Bihar CM Nitish Kumar
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

Nitish Kumar

PATNA: Chief minister Nitish Kumar said on Monday that he will personally talk to Union law and information technology (IT) minister Ravi Shankar Prasad on his demand of imposing a ban on pornography websites.

Speaking to reporters in his chamber at Bihar legislative assembly, Nitish said many “wrongdoings” (read rape) with women are happening due to the influence of pornographic websites.

Earlier, Nitish had written a letter to PM Narendra Modi on December 16 last year seeking ban on pornography websites. He had stated in the letter that incidents related to grave crime against women were being reported from almost every state and in many cases, videos of such crimes were being circulated on social media as well.

“It has been seen in many such cases, that the accused persons do wrong things (read rape or sexual assault), film the act and upload it to internet. Even the websites hosting such videos make money based on higher number of visitors. But all this needs to be stopped,” he said.

Nitish said he recently read about Ravi Shankar talking about ban on pornography websites. “I will speak to Ravi Shankar about ban on pornography the next time he is in Patna. Many such incidents (sexual assault and crime against women) are happening because of pornographic contents,” Nitish said.

The CM seems to have to proper reasons to be concerned. As per the latest National Crime Records Bureau (NCRB) report, altogether 651 rape cases were reported in Bihar in 2018. The report further stated that total number of cases of crime against women increased from 14,711 in 2017 to 16,920 in 2018.

Nitish in his letter to PM had mentioned about several provisions in Information Technology (IT) Act-2000 (as revised in 2008), which can be used to curb pornographic and immoral contents on the internet. Nitish claimed that such provisions were not getting implemented effectively.

State information and public relations department minister Neeraj Kumar said Section 67 of the IT Act criminalizes the use of IT means for display of pornographic content. “Pornography has been seen to incite sexual assault against women. Besides, in many cases, the culprits film the wrongdoings and use it for blackmailing victims so that they don’t complain to police. Thus, it is high time pornography is banned in the country. I believe such a proposal is already in consideration of the Centre, given the fact that Rajya Sabha Chairman M Venkaiah Naidu formed an informal group of MPs last month to study the issue of pornography on social media and its effect on children and society as a whole,” he said.

Title: Opposition huddle for anti-CAA meet in Kashi
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

Varanasi: After almost a month of violent protests against Citizenship (Amendment) Act and NRC, the Mau district on Monday witnessed a peaceful anti-CAA protest meeting of leaders from opposition parties, including Congress and Samajwadi Party, near Mau collectorate under the banner of Mau Nagrikta Manch (MNM).

Responding to the call of MNM, the supporters of opposition parties gathered at collectorate with the flags of their political parties as well as the national flag. Following a demonstration, they started their meeting.

Addressing the gathering, convenor of MNM Arvind Murti held the CAA as “against the soul of the Constitution and vision of Swami Vivekanand of an inclusive society”. He said that a country, which had given shelter to tortured people from different countries and religion, cant accept the CAA. He said that they had gathered to save the Constitution.

In his address, SP leader and former nagar palika chairman Arshad Jamal alleged that CAA was not only unconstitutional but also illogical due to giving communal colour to it. If you have to give citizenship, he said, it should be given without any discrimination on the basis of religion.

Mentioning NRC, he said that it is shameful that people of this country will have to prove their citizenship on their own soil. He said that the people of country will never give such proof and the government will have to roll back its decisions on CAA and NRC.

Title: NGOs oppose govt bid to revive Human dam project near Tadoba
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

Nagpur: The irrigation department, which is trying hard to push the controversial Human dam project near Tadoba, was reluctant to follow conditions recommended by the National Tiger Conservation Authority (NTCA).

Over 1.5 lakh trees will be felled and 1,926-hectare forest land in the functional corridor of Tadoba-Ghodazari diverted if the project is implemented. The dam project was discussed on Monday at an expert committee meeting called by its chairman and principal secretary (forest) Vikas Kharge at Mantralaya.

PCCF (wildlife) Nitin H Kakodkar, irrigation department executive engineer Arvind Gedam, deputy conservator (buffer) G Guruprasad, non-government members BNHS director Deepak Apte, Satpuda Foundation chief Kishor Rithe and Eco-Pro president Bandu Dhotre were present. NGO members unanimously opposed the project.

The irrigation department is pushing the project claiming to provide irrigation and drinking water to 160 villages in Saoli, Pombhurna, Mul and Chandrapur. Officials have also linked the project with checking Naxalite problem in Chandrapur.

“The dam will completely block corridor between Tadoba-Ghodazari-Umred-Karhandla-Navegaon-Nagzira. Since 2007, 140 human deaths have been reported in Chandrapur district alone and the dam would further flare up man-animal conflict as the situation then and now is completely different with number of tigers going up. There may be at least 175-200 tigers in Chandrapur district alone,” said environmentalist Debi Goenka.

On August 19, 2014, NTCA had set up a four-member committee for site appraisal of the project. In its November 2014 report, NTCA had asked to shift the project 5km upstream from the present site in Sirkada, which 3.5km from Tadoba.

The other two recommendations included procuring private land to restore structural corridor of 3-4km downstream and convert it into forest by planting native species. The panel had also suggested options to develop lift irrigation schemes, barrage, small dams etc instead of a major dam.

“However, the irrigation department is not ready to follow any of these conditions claiming the project will become unviable. At Monday’s meeting, irrigation officials were ready to create an artificial corridor up to 1km only,” said sources.

The project was conceived in 1983 and construction started in 1984-85. The work stopped because of violation of Forest (Conservation) Act of 1980. Conservationists have questioned need for the project after 36 years, especially when 20-22 major and minor irrigation projects like Gosikhurd, Ghodazari, Asolamendha and Nalleshwar have already come up in Chandrapur district.

Human or inhuman

* The cash-strapped state government wants to put Rs3,000 crore project on the track

* The major dam will lead to felling of 1,50,791 trees

* NTCA report gives a negative opinion about the project

* As per original plan, Human was initiated basically to supply 132 mm3 water to CSTPS but now a separate dam has been built on Irai river for it

* SC’s central empowered committee (CEC) raised concerns about the project in 2008

* Then minister Jairam Ramesh on September 8, 2009, too advised not to pursue the project

* In 36 years, entire landscape has changed with several small and medium dams coming up

* The project claims to irrigate 40,000-hectare land with 5,089 hectares submergence and 1,925 hectare of forest diversion

ENDS

Title: Bihar: Delhi police nabs kingpin of drug racket
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

Representative image

MUZAFFARPUR: A special cell team of Delhi police arrested Md Saidullah , kingpin of a drug racket, from his rented accommodation in Gobarsahi locality of the town on Sunday and took him to the national capital.

SHO of Sadar police station Mithilesh Kumar Jha said an inspector-rank official of the special cell of Delhi police had sought the help of local police to arrest Saidullah, a resident of Malda town in West Bengal. “Since Saidullah was not wanted in any criminal case in the district, we just assisted the Delhi police in nabbing him. He was carrying a reward of Rs 1 lakh on his head announced by the Delhi police,” Jha added.

A source in the police department said Saidullah was arrested on the basis of electronic surveillance. “His two accomplices were arrested by Delhi police nearly a week ago with a consignment of 10kg of heroin. They informed the police about Saidullah’s hideout in Bihar. The electronic surveillance helped Delhi police zero in on Saidullah,” the source added.

Title: MGU to introduce innovative courses
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

PATNA: The Munger University (MGU) senate on Monday decided to introduce some innovative courses with a view to ensuring socio-economic development of the region and increasing the employment potential of the local youths.

The senate, at its meeting held under the chairmanship of vice-chancellor Ranjit Kumar Verma, decided to introduce one-year postgraduate diploma courses in fragrance flavour and aroma technology, food safety and quality management, disaster management and investigation and security management. Besides, it also decided to introduce a certificate course in endangered languages.

The senate further approved the proposal to introduce integrated five-year MA, MSc and MCom courses with lateral exit and entry after successful completion of three years of studies. Admission to the five-year course will be open to plus two (senior secondary) passouts. Provision of lateral entry into the integrated course will be only for BA, BSc and BCom passouts.

MGU VC Ranjit Kumar Singh said the university has also decided to start four-year integrated BA/BSc and BEd courses for plus two passouts.

The senate approved the designs of logo, seal, emblem and flag of the university. Earlier, the selection of logo, seal, emblem and flag designs was made on the basis of an all India open competition in which a large number of entries were received. Then a committee of experts held a marathon meeting at Patna University guesthouse recently and made the final selection with some improvisations.

The artists whose entries in all the four categories were declared to be the best and which have finally been selected by the university will be invited at the university’s next foundation day celebrations and given the awards, the VC said.

Title: BJP reviled through dustbin posters
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

The posters were removed within a few hours by the civic officials

SURAT: Just when a Swachh Survekshan team is expected to arrive in the city for citizen feedback and do spot inspection on cleanliness, some miscreants have pasted dustbins placed at various places with posters that intend to show them as donation boxes of BJP. The posters are mischief by the miscreants to score political points for their masters who are engaged in a bitter political fight with the BJP which controls the civic body, sources said.

On Monday morning, these posters were found pasted on the dustbins placed outside Majura MLA Harsh Sanghvi’s house, police commissioner’s office, district collector’s office, science centre, Surya Palace, Rajni Corner, Kings Corner in Citylight, Joggers’ Park on Ghod Dod Road, West Field Tower, St Xavier’s School and Vanita Vishram School. Posters were pasted on several dustbins placed in Limbayat and Udhna too. The posters were removed within a few hours by the civic officials.

Opposition Congress councillors earlier alleged BJP had illegally awarded litter collection contracts and was involved in litter box purchase scam too. Some people have questioned the cost at which these dustbins have been purchased. These dustbins were purchased in 2019 before the Swacch Survekshan team visited the city. The purchase was done at different levels by respective zones as per their requirement. Many of these dustbins were found damaged some time ago and solid waste spilled out of them on the roads. Majura MLA Harsh Sanghvi had questioned the purchase of the dustbins and demanded the agency that supplied the substandard material dealt with strictly.

Sanghvi said, “This gimmick shows the mindset of the miscreants and also of those with whom they are aligned with.”

Ashish Naik, deputy commissioner of health, SMC, has expressed his displeasure at this political gimmick. “This is work of some miscreants. We hope these elements desist from spoiling the city’s image in the country.”

SMC sources said this could be the handiwork of activists of student wing of a political party in the opposition.

Title: Man gets three-year jail for power theft
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

Representative image

RAJKOT: The special electricity court in Una sentenced a man to three years imprisonment in a three-year-old power theft.

The court also imposed a fine of Rs 27.84 lakh on the convict Ashok Chavda. An FIR was lodged in GUVNL police station in Junagadh on April 30, 2016 against Chavda who was found indulging in electricity theft during raid conducted by a team of Paschim Gujarat Vi Company Ltd (PGVCL).

Chavda was found mining stones in the government wasteland on the outskirts of Bhiyal village in Gir-Gadhda taluka during the raid. The officials had also recovered one motor of 20 horsepower and two motors of 10 horsepower used in stone mining. He was accused of power theft worth Rs 9.28 lakh.

When the case came on trial, the accused pleaded not guilty and preferred a full trial. The prosecution submitted statements of 18 witnesses and 15 documentary evidence to prove its case.

Special court judge SL Thakkar ordered Chavda to pay Rs 9.28 lakh to PGVCL from the fine amount, said additional public prosecutor MK Gohel.

Title: Parliamentary panel questions Delhi Police’s handling of student protests
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

Some panel members complained that such protests had set a wrong precedent and hurt the image of Delhi Police ... Read More

NEW DELHI: Opposition MPs in the parliamentary committee on home affairs on Monday objected to the use of force by the Delhi Police against students and suggested that efforts be made to engage protesting students through peaceful means like dialogue.

While a source insisted that no specific incidents — be it the police action in Jamia Millia Islamia in view of violent anti-CAA protests or the recent clashes in JNU — were raised during the deliberations by the panel, it is learnt that the police action against students came in for criticism. Some members suggested that the agitating students could have been dealt with in a more mature manner, since they are not criminals.

The meeting of the standing committee, chaired by Congress MP in Rajya Sabha Anand Sharma, was attended by senior officers of the home ministry (home secretary Ajay Bhalla was excused from appearance) and police brass of Delhi, Haryana, UP and Rajasthan. While Delhi Police commissioner Amulya Patnaik is said to have given a detailed briefing to the committee on the state of crime in the capital, the DGPs or their representatives from neighbouring states brought up the crime/law and order issues arising due to their proximity to the capital.

The opposition party MPs are said to have objected to frequent invoking of prohibitory orders (Section 144 of Criminal Procedure Code) in Delhi, which bars assembly of more than 4 persons, as a precautionary measure against protests. Section 144, it was pointed out, often becomes a prelude to police action. Some members of the committee insisted that the provision be used sparingly, particularly where students are involved.

The Delhi Police chief was also questioned by the parliamentary panel on protests staged by police staffers in November following their scuffle with lawyers. The siege outside the police headquarters, which had seriously affected traffic movement, was seen by some as an act of indiscipline by members of the force. Some panel members complained that such protests had set a wrong precedent and hurt the image of Delhi Police.

Title: Cops set to launch free ‘Suraksha’ taxi service
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

PATNA: In view of the frequent incidents of cash loot in Vaishali, police have decided to provide ‘Suraksha’ taxi service to people, who carry a sum of more than Rs 1 lakh with them.

Newly-appointed SP, Gaurav Mangla, told this newspaper on Monday, “The free facility will be made available in a day or two. We will also issue a toll-free number for the purpose. All you have to do is make a call on the number and provide details like place where the ‘Suraksha’ taxi has to reach, mobile number and destination where the cash is to be taken under police escort.”

Mangla, who was transferred from Munger to Vaishali two weeks ago, pointed out that each police station in the district would have at least two patrolling vehicles. “One of them will be used as a ‘Suraksha’ taxi. If required, we will provide additional police force and vehicles to the person concerned,” he said.

The SP revealed that the service was launched in Munger on an experimental basis and the response was overwhelming. “Although the transaction of cash in Munger was not as frequent as it is in the Tirhut range, the facility worked wonders and incidents of cash loot reduced substantially there,” he said.

Mangla has also made the provision of proper monitoring of the new facility. “The service is meant only for common people. In no case, it will be provided to private companies as there is a separate guideline for them so far as transportation of huge cash is concerned. Police escort is provided to such companies at a fixed rate,” he clarified.

Vaishali, considered to be a crime-prone district under Tirhut range, recorded altogether 98 incidents of robbery and 83 of road robbery from January to September, 2019. However, no incident of bank robbery or bank dacoity was reported from any part of the district. Altogether 60 people were killed in the district during the period. However, majority of them lost their lives while resisting loot and robberies.

“The new system will act as a deterrent to criminals involved in cash loot in the district,” said Chandra Bhushan Mishra, a businessman based in Hajipur.

Title: New ‘Traffic Park’ thrown open to visitors in Patna
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

Transport department officials claimed that approximately 502 people, including kids, youngsters, and old peop... Read More

PATNA: A ‘Traffic Park’, which has been developed in an area of 2,500 feet at Shaheed Veer Kunwar Singh Azadi Park on Hardinge Road, was thrown open to visitors on Monday.

Built by the state transport department, the park will create awareness about issues like traffic rules, emergency services, signals, road safety through lane markings, zebra crossings, diversions and road signage among people.

Transport department officials claimed that approximately 502 people, including kids, youngsters, and old people, visited the park on Day 1.

“This is the only ‘Traffic Park’ designed specially for children to make them learn traffic rules in an interesting manner. There are miniature roads, zebra crossings, and traffic signs here,” transport secretary Sanjay Kumar Agarwal told this newspaper on Monday.

NCC cadets will explain traffic rules to the visitors in a simplified way by holding workshops and enacting street plays. Agarwal said, “This park is our gift to Patnaites during the Road Safety Week. There will be no entry fee, but a register will be maintained to keep a record of the visitors.”

Meanwhile, Patnaites hailed the transport department’s initiative. Gardanibagh resident Vidya Sahay said, “My son loved spending time here and was interested in learning traffic rules. I will bring him again.”

Many young couples and collegians also showed interest in learning traffic rules and regulations. Manisha Singh, a student of Magadh Mahila College, said, “It has been six months since I started riding a scooty, but do not know the traffic rules well. I will be back soon.”

6-day ‘corrective’ classes for violators: The transport department is likely to conduct six-day corrective classes for traffic violators at Sultan Palace from Tuesday.

“To ensure that they attend the classes, we will seize their drive licences and vehicles. A syllabus has also been prepared by the experts of Institute of Driving Training and Traffic Research in Aurangabad,” transport secretary Sanjay Kumar Agarwal said and added the classes would be held in two batches from 11am to 12.30pm and 1pm to 2.30pm.

Agarwal further said, “If a person is caught for overspeeding, jumping traffic lights or driving without helmet and seatbelt, he will get a challan and told to attend the corrective classes. The person concerned will not get back his licence and vehicle, unless he does so.”

Title: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath to defend CAA in Gaya rally today
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

Yogi Adityanath

GAYA: The district unit of BJP has left no stone unturned to ensure large turnout of people at Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath’s public meeting at Gandhi Maidan here on Tuesday. Dhanraj Sharma, the BJP’s Gaya district unit chief, is overseeing preparations for the meeting.

Senior minister and Gaya town MLA Prem Kumar has also oiled his election machinery to make the event a big success. The UP CM’s meeting is the first major exercise of the BJP in the state to create mass awareness on Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA). Yogi is scheduled to reach the airport here in an aircraft of Uttar Pradesh government around 11am. He will go straight to the meeting venue from the airport.

According to BJP sources, the event will also test the mobilisation capacity of party ticket aspirants for the upcoming assembly elections.

Asked about the arrangements for the UP CM’s meeting, Gaya DM Abhishek Singh said it being a party programme, the role of the administration was limited to the maintenance of law and order. “Sadar SDO and city DSP are in regular touch with the meeting organisers,” said the DM.

Separate teams of the NSG and UP police have also arrived here to coordinate with district officials. The UP police team is led by a DIG rank officer.

Meanwhile, Omair Khan alias Tikka Khan, convener of the ‘Samvidhan Bachao Morcha’, has appealed to the district administration to depute adequate number of policemen near the ongoing dharna site in the Shantibagh locality of the town during the UP CM’s visit. Hundreds of men and women are observing indefinite dharna at Shantibagh here since December 29 against the CAA and National Register of Citizens (NRC).

Title: Rajasthan: Kite & manjha sales soar on Makar Sankranti eve
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

Their excitement knew no bounds when they finally selected and purchased kites and manjha they had chosen

JAIPUR: Be it five-year-old Mohammad Irrfan or 65-year-old Ramesh Khandelwal, both were equally excited when they reached a kite shop at Haldiyon Ka Raasta on Monday. Their excitement knew no bounds when they finally selected and purchased kites and manjha they had chosen.

Similar scenes were witnessed across the city on the eve of Makar Sakranti as revellers went on a shopping spree on the eve of the kite festival. Handipura near Ramganj Bazaar, which is the most sought after place of kite lovers, was choc-a-bloc throughout the day. The market is flooded with kites from Rampur, Hathras, Bareilly and Moradabad.

“The momentum picked up from afternoon. We had to bring extra bunches of kites from the godown,” said Naeem Qureshi, a wholesale kite dealer from Bareilly.

He added there had been a sudden rise in the sale as most people indulged in last-minute shopping. “Ab to ek do din ka dhandha reh gaye, pehle maheenon chalta thaa (Now the business is confined to one or two days, earlier it used to be a month-long affair),” said Liyaqat Ali, a 65-year-old wholesale trader at Haldiyon Ka Raasta.

Interestingly, some of the traders had placed loud speakers to make announcements “Chinese manjha mangkar sharminda na karen” (Don’t embarrass us by asking for Chinese manjha).

“We have urged our customers not to leave the manjha the moment a kite is snapped as it might endanger lives. It is better to roll the rest of manjha after kites snap so that it doesn’t harm any person,” said a trader. Likewise, heavy rush was seen at shops selling feeni, gajak and other items across the city. Majority of the traders would be allowed to keep their shops open till midnight. “Traders of Walled City, who run shops throughout the day, usually start buying kites after closing their shops. So, keeping our kites shops open in the night is very necessary,” said a trader.

Title: Maharashtra: Albino sambar sighted in Navegaon national park
Content:
a rare occurrence, an albino sambar deer was recorded at Navegaon National Park in Gondia district last week

The solo herbivore, estimated to be around 7-8 months, was sighted by forest guard Hitendra Anarse during patrolling

NAGPUR: Considered a rare occurrence, an albino sambar deer was recorded at Navegaon National Park in Gondia district last week.The solo herbivore, estimated to be around 7-8 months, was sighted by forest guard Hitendra Anarse during patrolling. “Our staff was surprised to see the white animal with pinkish ears resting in the dense grassy patch,” said Poonam Pate, deputy director, Navegaon-Nagzira Tiger Reserve ( NNTR ).“Generally, probability of an albino sambar in protected areas is less. The said animal seems to be unique with complete loss of pigmentation. Hence, its skin was pale compared to other members of its species,” said Pate.She added, “Generally, sambars are social animals and live in groups but experts say such albino animals are not accepted by the groups and hence was sighted alone.”There are very few records of albino sambar. Dr Bahar Baviskar, a wildlife veterinarian, recalls he had sighted such sambar in Pench Tiger Reserve (PTR), Maharashtra, in 2013.“It is not necessary that mothers reject such fawns. Otherwise, it would not have reached 8 months of age without the mother’s care,” Dr Baviskar said.“But it is true that albino animals may face obstacles in nature as in some cases they have trouble finding a mate, and their inability to camouflage themselves makes them more vulnerable to predators,” Dr Baviskar said.Another wildlife vet Dr Prayag HS says, “Non-mammal animals can also be albino, but because they can produce other pigments in addition to melanin, they may not appear fully white.”WHAT IS ALBINISM?In mammals, albinism occurs when an individual inherits one or more mutated genes from both parents that interfere with the body’s production of melanin, the main pigment that determines the colour of skin, fur and eyes. The production of melanin occurs within melanocytes, specialized cells that are present but not fully functional in albino mammals.

Title: Rs 17k vanishes from P C Sorcar Jr daughter’s a/c, cop lens on conman
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

Kolkata: Magician PC Sorcar’s daughter, actor Moubani, has become the city’s latest victim of phishing after she found herself trapped by a “suave, English-speaking” fraudster over phone last Saturday and lost Rs 17,000 from her bank account linked to a payment gateway. The 32-year-old lodged a complaint on Monday and said she was duped by the way the fraudster spoke to her, claiming to be an executive associated with a payment gateway. “It was only after I had transferred Rs 17,000, that I realized I was conned,”Sorcar told TOI.

According to her, on Saturday, she was in the middle of an audition when she received a call from a person who introduced himself as a representative of Paytm who said she had won an LED TV worth Rs 49,000 from Paytm Mall in a lucky draw. “Since my childhood, I have won a number of lotteries and so I thought my lucky charm had worked again. He said I needed to deposit Rs 5,000 to a Paytm account to redeem the prize. He gave me an account number and I transferred the money,” she said.

Sometime later, the man called again and said that the gift had been processed, but Sorcar had to pay Rs 11,999 as GST. “I was sceptic, but he sent me a number of documents, like his Aadhaar card, PAN card and his office ID, over WhatsApp and said the money would be refunded immediately. I was foolish to believe him and again transferred the money,” Sorcar said.

However, when the man called again asking for more money, the actor realized she was being conned. “The man said the last transaction had been cancelled and asked me to send the money again. I realized he was taking me for a ride and demanded my money back. He first changed his voice and posed as a senior official, but when I threatened to report the matter to the cops, he disconnected the call,” she added.

Cops have issued an alert asking payment-app users to be aware of fraudsters who pose as customer service operators of companies. The conmen steal money either by phishing or by gaining access to the victims’ mobile screens after getting them to install a screen-sharing app and gaining access to card details.

Title: Four undertrials break lock of barrack, escape from jail
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

Police investigate inside the prison premises on Monday

Rajkot: In a huge embarrassment for police , four undertrials accused in serious crimes escaped from Limbdi sub-jail in Surendranagar district by breaking the lock of their barrack, climbing a 12 foot wall and cutting the b arbed fence in the cover of darkness on Sunday night.

Police said the accused, identified as Vijay Karapada, Mayursinh Jadeja, Ramesh Karu and Dinesh Shukla, made good their escape from barrack number-2.

“The crime was detected when the jail authorities checked the barrack and found its lock had been severed and the doors wide open. We have cordoned off various exit and entry points of Limbdi and intensified manhunt for the accused,” said D B Basiya, Limbdi deputy superintendent of police.

Karapada, a native of Ramparada village of Muli taluka in Surendranagar district, was jailed for attempt to murder and loot offences registered against him. Jadeja, a resident of Bidada Padar village of Mandvi taluka in Kutch district, was imprisoned for the offence of a loot in Sayla. Karu, a native of Bhimasar village of Anjar taluka in Kutch district, was jailed in a case related to abatement of suicide. Shukla, a resident of Railnagar in Rajkot, was incarcerated in a murder case of Than. Shukla had fled from Limbdi police station in 2014 and was rearrested.

“The incident occurred when renovation work was underway inside the jail premises. The accused made the most of the situation after finding a ladder lying against the 12-feet high wall. The accused used the ladder to climb the wall and then cut the barb wires with the cutter,” said Basiya.

While the four inmates were fleeing, two others — Bharat Rojasara and Viram Jejharia — did not run away as they were fast asleep. “Rojasara and Jejharia said they were sleeping at that time and didn’t even know what was happening,” said S S Varu, sub-inspector with Limbdi police station.

The four prisoners were booked on the complaint of jailer Parbat Goyal. There are 49 under-trial prisoners lodged in Limbdi sub-jail at present.

Title: 35% of compact sedan Aura sales will be diesel: Hyundai
Content:
Hyundai Aura (file photo)

READ ALSO |

02:25Hyundai Aura first look

CHENNAI: Hyundai Motor India is making a significant BSVI diesel play with its upcoming compact sedan Aura targeting at least 30%-35% sales to come from it. This is in contrast to competitors like Maruti Suzuki which will phase out the diesel engine option in Dzire on migrating to BSVI. Same holds true for Tata Tigor and Volkswagen Ameo which will offer only petrol options in BSVI versions. Ford Aspire and Honda Amaze however, will continue to offer BSVI diesel.Hyundai opens bookings for compact sedan Aura“We are looking at 6,000-8,000 units a month for the sedan segment and from that we are looking at 30%-35% volumes to come from diesel. Currently that’s the average diesel penetration of our range though SUVs sell more diesel. The Aura is fitted with a new generation BSVI diesel engine so to begin with diesel contribution will be high,” said Puneet Anand, senior GM & group head marketing, Hyundai Motor India.The diesel play is also aimed at non-metro customers. The Hyundai Aura has two petrol and one diesel engine options and Hyundai is positioning the car as an affordable sedan for millennials. “We are looking at not just metro markets but tier-2 and tire-3 towns given the aspirational factor in those markets,” said Anand. “We are the first company to give BS6 diesel option in the compact sedan segment. Diesel is very vibrant. People driving 80-100 km a day still prefer diesel,” he added. Hyundai will plug the Aura as a personal use car while the Xcent will be “for commercial use and will be available in petrol and CNG versions only”.Bookings for the Aura opened on January 3. While the price has not yet been announced, the general range in compact sedans is between Rs 5.8-Rs 9 lakh. “The Aura will be very competitively priced because we want to position it as an affordable sedan. There is a lot of competition to balance with existing products,” he said“Like the Venue, the Aura too will hit export markets, may be after 5-6 months once the initial rush of domestic demand is over,” he added.

Title: Bihar third in kidnapping cases across country in 2018
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

Representative image

PATNA: Bihar had the third highest kidnapping and abduction cases across the country in 2018, the latest National Crime Records Bureau (NCRB) data revealed. A total of 9,935 cases of kidnapping were recorded in Bihar, which was 9.4% of such cases across the country.

The maximum number of 21,711 kidnapping and abduction cases were reported from Uttar Pradesh, followed by 11,443 in Maharashtra. Mizoram, Sikkim and Nagaland with 3, 74 and 90 cases respectively were at the bottom of the table on such crime. In Bihar, average 8.4 persons per one lakh of the population were kidnapped or abducted against average 8 in the country.

Compared to previous year’s data, Bihar witnessed an increase of 1,456 incidents of kidnapping and abduction from 2017 when the number of such cases stood at 8,479 while it was 7,324 in 2016. Out of total kidnapping cases in Bihar, maximum 6,671 were of women for marriage (Section 366 of IPC). There were 46 cases of kidnapping for ransom and 16 for human trafficking while 1163 were related to kidnapping and abduction for other reasons.

ADG (CID) Vinay Kumar said after the Supreme Court’s order in 2013, even a missing person case is lodged in kidnapping category. “We are a state which believes in free registration. Even if a child is missing or a boy runs away before his exam result, or someone elopes in a love affair, a kidnapping case is registered. It is actually a good sign for us that most of the cases are registered. However, the figure for professional kidnapping is only in double digit,” said Vinay. He further said that around 90,000 FIRs were lodged in 2000, around 2.65 lakh in 2018 and the figure for 2019 is likely to cross 3 lakh.

Apart from kidnapping and abduction, the state also witnessed an increase of 1,954 incidents of crime against children from 2017 to 2018. As per the NCRB data, total 7,340 such incidents were recorded in 2018, while the figure for 2017 was 5386. However, the state’s rate of crime against children, which is calculated on per one lakh population was 16.4, which was almost half the national average of 31.8 crimes per one lakh population.

Altogether 62 children were murdered in Bihar in 2018 and 10 of them were below six years of age, while 17 were between six years to 12 years and 35 above 12 years but below 16 years. Altogether 2,094 incidents of sexual harassment against children were reported in 2018, while 252 children were booked under The Juvenile Justice Care and Protection of Children Act, 2000 & 2015.

As per the NCRB figures, major crime against children in 2018 across the country were related to kidnapping and abduction (44.2%) and under the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences Act, 2012 (34.7%), including child rape.

Title: Bihar: Ara bomb blast case convict dies
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

Representative image

ARA: A life term convict, Pramod Singh, died under mysterious circumstances in Ara district jail on Monday.

Pramod, a resident of Ekbari village under Sahar police station in Bhojpur district, was awarded life sentence in connection with the bomb blast on the Ara civil court premises on January 23, 2015. A constable and a woman were killed and several others were injured in the blast.

Ara district jail superintendent Yusuf Rizwan said Pramod was rushed to Ara Sadar hospital around 6am on Monday when he did not wake up. The doctors there, however, declared him brought dead. “The autopsy report is awaited. The cause of his death will be ascertained only after receiving the autopsy report,” he added.

The jail superintendent said Pramod was fine till he went to bed on Sunday night. His other ward inmates told the officials that Pramod woke up around midnight to answer the call of nature and again went to bed. “The inmates suspected foul play when he didn’t wake up in the morning,” the jail superintendent said.

Pramod’s family members created a scene outside the hospital premises and demanded a probe into the cause of his death. They accused the jail authorities of negligence leading to Pramod’s death. Subsequently, his postmortem was conducted under the supervision of a medical board and a magistrate at the Sadar hospital.

Altogether eight people were convicted in the 2015 bomb last case in August last year. While one convict Lambu Sharma was awarded death sentence, others including Pramod were awarded life imprisonment.

Title: Miscreants shot at woman in loot bid
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

Representative image

MUZAFFARPUR: Unidentified criminals shot at and injured a woman near Tarwa-Majhaulia village under Paru police station on Sunday evening.

The woman, identified as Kiran Devi, has been undergoing treatment at a private nursing home where doctors declared her out of danger.

The incident took place at around 8pm when Kiran, along with her husband, was returning home at Srisia village after appearing in the constable recruitment examination at in Muzaffarpur .

Narrating the incident, her husband Prashant Kumar said four masked men tried to stop them near Majhaulia Chowk. “However, I drove away my motorbike apprehending something fishy. This infuriated them and they opened fired. I had a miraculous escape but one of the bullets hit the left hand of my wife. I mustered courage and managed to reach the nearby government primary health centre at Devaria Kothi for her treatment,” he said.

Prashant said the doctors of PHC referred her wife to the town for better treatment. “Later, I took her to a private nursing home. Doctors told me she is out of danger,” he said.

Paru SHO Sanjay Swaroop reached the nursing home and recorded the statement of the couple.

He said raids were on to nab the criminals. “We have registered a complaint based on the statement of Prashant against four miscreants,” he said.

Title: Nitish Kumar’s statements different from his actions: Tejashwi Prasad Yadav
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

Tejashwi Prasad Yadav

PATNA: Leader of opposition in state assembly Tejashwi Prasad Yadav on Monday hit out at CM Nitish Kumar for “delaying” discussion on Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA) in the House. Talking to reporters outside the state assembly, Tejashwi said Nitish should have immediately discussed CAA in the House instead of waiting for the next session, when it will be “too late”.

“The CM should have extended the special session of the House by a day and discussed the issue. Gazette notification on CAA has already been published and people will suffer now. The CM’s delaying tactics shows his intentions. He is tired and in a compromising mode. He is with BJP and RSS just to hold the post of CM,” Tejashwi, who was also accompanied by his elder brother Tej Pratap, said.

Tejashwi also criticized the CM for “changing” his stand on Article 370. “Nitish had earlier said that he was against Article 370. However, he took U-turn later. There is a huge difference between what he says and what he does,” Tejashwi said.

On Nitish’s demand for caste-based census, Tejashwi said instead of paying lip service, the CM should meet home minister Amit Shah and discuss the issue. “It is another matter whether Shah will meet him or not as we all know Nitishji’s political stature now,” Tejashwi said, adding that he will embark on a yatra in Seemanchal region from January 15 to protest against implementation of CAA and proposed introduction of NRC in the country.

Title: Ganja cultivation busted in Rajkot, farmer arrested
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

Accused in police custody

RAJKOT: A farmer was arrested for an alleged cultivation of ganja (marijuana) in Kharachia village of Jetpur taluka in Rajkot district and a drug trafficker was arrested with eight kg ganja from Dhoraji of Rajkot district, while another drug dealer was nabbed in Junagadh city in the past 24 hours.

In Kharachia village, Vaju Senjalia (55) was arrested for ganja cultivation in his farm. “We have recovered three kg ganja plants worth Rs 14,580 from Senjalia’s possession. Senjalia said that he was a drug addict and that he had cultivated ganja to sell it to other addicts,” said S V Gojia, sub-inspector with Jetpur taluka police station.

In Dhoraji, Afzal Lulania (38) was arrested with eight kg ganja worth Rs 56,000. “Lulania said he had brought the contraband from Surat for selling it in Dhoraji,” said S G Palacharya, inspector with Rajkot rural special operation group (SOG).

Meanwhile near Junagadh railway station, Chandrakant Bhatt (31) was arrested with 5.62 kg ganja worth Rs 50,620. “We had a prior information that Bhatt was carrying the contraband that he had procured in Devgadh Baria, and was coming to Rajkot by train. Following this, we kept a watch at the station and nabbed Bhatt the moment he alighted from the train,” said N B Barot, inspector with Junagadh SOG.

Title: Davinder Singh: Got Rs 12 lakh to help J&K terrorists reach Delhi, admits arrested DSP
Content: SRINAGAR: Deputy superintendent of police Davinder Singh , who was arrested on Saturday along with two Hizb terrorists and a Hizb overground worker in Kulgam , has told his interrogators that he had received Rs 12 lakh from the terrorists to ferry them to Jammu and then Chandigarh for their onward journey to New Delhi, IG (Kashmir) Vijay Kumar told the media here on Monday. Intelligence sources said the terrorists planned to carry out attacks on Republic Day.The DSP was suspended on Monday and is likely to be stripped of all his awards, including the President’s Police Medal for anti-militancy operations.Davinder, who was interrogated by various intelligence agencies, including IB, military intelligence and RAW, besides the police, has disclosed that he had put up the terrorists at his Indira Nagar house in Srinagar , right next to the Army’s 15 Corps HQ, and thereafter accompanied them to Jammu in a Maruti car driven by the Hizb overground worker, intelligence sources claimed.Meanwhile, sources said the Union home ministry may hand over the case to the NIA to find the real motive of the terrorists, Davinder’s links to terrorism and whether he had helped terrorists in the past as well.The two Hizb terrorists arrested with Davinder are Naveed Babu alias Babar Azam, a resident of Nazneenpora in south Kashmir’s Shopian district , and his associate Rafi Ahmad Rather. The Hizb overground worker, identified as Irfan Shafi Mir, was driving the vehicle when it was intercepted by the police on Saturday. Irfan Shafi Mir has travelled to Pakistan five times on his passport.Davinder, interestingly, was on duty ensuring security cover for the envoys of 15 countries who visited Srinagar at the Union government’s invitation last week.In Video: Got Rs 12 lakh to help J&K terrorists reach Delhi, admits arrested DSP Davinder Singh

Title: Met: Biting cold to continue for two more days, rain likely on Jan 16, 17
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

PATNA: The state is likely to witness a wet spell of varying intensity in the next couple of days owing to the western disturbance coming from central Rajasthan and adjoining Pakistan, which led to severe cold day conditions at many places, including Patna, on Monday.

If the weathermen are to be believed, people of the state will not get any respite from prevailing biting cold conditions till January 15.

The Skymet Weather bulletin predicted on Monday that the weather in eastern India may remain dry, but east Uttar Pradesh and parts of Bihar may experience light to moderate rainfall on January 16 and 17 and again on January 19.

“The fresh cyclonic circulation that has already arrived in the country will cause rain in the northern plains and snowfall in the northern hills. Due to this system, parts of Bihar will continue to face cold day conditions at least for the next 48 hours,” the Skymet report said.

Minimum temperature in Patna dropped by 0.7 degree Celsius on Monday and settled at 8.2 degrees C. Maximum temperature, on the other hand, slipped to 14 from 15.2 degrees Celsius recorded on Sunday, leading to shivering cold in the city.

The highest maximum and lowest minimum temperatures of 21.2 degrees Celsius and 6 degrees Celsius were recorded at Dehri and Gaya and Dehri, respectively, on Sunday.

According to Patna Meteorological Centre, dry weather would prevail in most parts of the state over the next 48 hours. “Cold day and severe cold day conditions were observed at some places and moderate to dense fog at many places in the state in the last 24 hours. The skies in Patna were covered with cloud due to formation of moisture in the atmosphere,” the local Met office said.

The Indian Meteorological Department has also issued forecast for dense fog at few places in the state over the next two days. “There would be significant change in night temperature in Bihar over the next 24 hours,” it said.

Flights delayed due to poor visibility: A chaotic situation prevailed at Jayaprakash Narayan International Airport, Patna, as 18 flights were delayed by more than an hour on Monday due to poor visibility. Some other flights suffered minor delays.

Ten flights of IndiGo, seven of SpiceJet and one of GoAir were delayed by more than an hour. Flight operations at the city airport became normal after 10.45am as the minimum required visibility of 1,000m was reached at 10.20am.

Meanwhile, three Delhi-bound flights – two of GoAir (G8-2511/ 2512 and G8-231/132) and one of Air India (AI-409/410) – were cancelled on Monday due to operational reasons.

Title: Startup Pando gets Rs 64cr in Series A
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

Chennai-based logistics tech startup Pando has raised Rs 64 crore (roughly $9 million) in a Series A funding round led by VC firm Chiratae Ventures with participation from Siemens’ venture investment arm Next47, and existing investor Nexus Venture Partners.

Pando is Next47’s first investment in Asia.

This is Pando’s second institutional round after a seed round of around $2 million in March 2018, and with this, the startup has raised over Rs 80 crores, to date.

Without disclosing the valuation at which the current funding was raised, Pando co-founder and CEO Nitin Jayakrishnan told TOI that the startup has grown its valuation ‘a little over 3x’ since the last raise. Lak Ananth, MD, Next47, and TC Meenakshisundaram, founder MD, Chiratae Ventures join the startup’s board. The funding round also saw participation from marquee angel investors including VMWare India's Ramkumar Narayan, Indifi CEO Alok Mittal, and Saikiran Krishnamurthy of xto10x Ventures.

Pando’s platform helps businesses across multiple industries automate and optimize freight management operations, and connects them to logistics vendors and aggregators.

The funds will be used to augment the company's talent and technology and cement its position in the Indian market.

Plans are also on to expand reach of their freight management software in global markets including Europe and South East Asia, Jayakrishnan said.

We have grown our revenues around 3-4x in the last one year with inbound interest for our solution from both Indian clients as well as Indian operations of MNCs, he added. Pando expects to benefit from Chiratae’s expertise in the consumer software space, and believes that Next47's experience of working with similar global logistics tech enterprises will help them scale faster.

The startup's development and engineering team is based out of Chennai with sales teams across Bengaluru, Bombay and Delhi.

Title: Missing minor traced to Ladakh, reunited with kin
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

Kolkata: The Kolkata Leather Complex police, on December 19, managed to bring back a 17-year-old girl from Jammu after she left her east Kolkata home to stay with a 22-year-old merchant from Kashmir on December 5. City-based doctor Jayanta Mukherjee — who helped the family get their daughter back — took to Facebook on Monday to praised the local police on Facebook on Monday.

The girl got infatuated with her Facebook friend, who lived in Kathua, after conversing with him on social media for a few months. “She was upset when the internet connection became irregular following protests over the scrapping of Article 370 in Kashmir. That was when the duo decided she would travel to Kashmir to be with him,” an officer said.

“He sent a flight ticket for Delhi and she left home. On reaching Delhi, she switched off her cellphone and met her friend. They first went to Kathua and then, a few days later, they settled in Ladakh,” the officer added.

In Kolkata, the girl’s family had lodged a missing complaint by then. “We sent a team to Jammu and the Jammu police helped us investigate the man’s residence. We then suspected she might have gone to Ladakh. The local cops helped us track her down on December 19 and she was finally handed over to her family after completing all legal formalities,” another officer said.

The cops said it didn’t matter if both of them had planned the escape together. “The victim is a minor and her consent is not important,” said an officer.

“Kudos to Kolkata (KLC PS) police for recovering the daughter of my assistant ... My opinion regarding our police force has been enhanced,” Banerjee wrote on Facebook.

Title: Flipkart tightens returns policy on rising frauds
Content:
