This story is from January 14, 2020

(File photo)

BENGALURU: Consumers buying winter fashion and lifestyle products on Flipkart will get less time to return products as the Walmart-owned e-tailer is tightening its returns policy. Flipkart is reducing the returns window for the segment to 10 days, from 30 days earlier, suspecting fraud orders by consumers, resulting in a ‘drastic rise’ in returns.

Flipkart has communicated the change to its merchants selling these goods. This is the first such change in its returns policy with a direct impact on consumers under the new parent Walmart . Fashion is one of the top three categories driving its gross sales alongside smartphones and large appliances. In terms of margins, fashion offers the highest for e-tailers, including Flipkart.

Broadly, lifestyle and clothing were the only verticals allowing for a 30-day return or replacement on Flipkart according to its website. All the other categories allow only a 10-day period following a change in policy during 2016-17.

It is suspected that consumers, at a staggering pace, might have ordered new winter clothes and other products and then returned it weeks later after using it, pushing Flipkart to make this change in its policy, people aware of the matter said. The high rate of returns ends up adding to operating costs for both e-commerce companies and their sellers.

This is the first time Flipkart is making such changes in the fashion and lifestyle segment, one of the merchants who sells on Flipkart said. “Typically 15-20% of orders placed during an average business day are returned or replaced. This time, it must be much higher that Flipkart has spotted the trend and made this move,” this person added.

In comparison, Amazon continues to offer a 30-day return period for fashion and lifestyle products here, according to its website. Amazon too has a 10-day window for returns in segments like consumer electronics and smartphones.

“To reduce these fraudulent activities and to save you from such fraud buyers, the return/replacement policy for the below list of verticals is being changed from 30 days to 10 days,” Flipkart has told merchants. TOI has reviewed the communication. “Also note that this change has been done to protect your interest and to save you from fraudulent returns,” it added. Jackets, sweaters, sweatshirts, coats and thermals are some of the categories that will come under the new policy.

A Flipkart spokesperson confirmed the development. “To ensure that we continue to protect the interests of lakhs of sellers, especially small businesses, on our platform, we have altered the time frame of our return/replacement policy for certain lifestyle categories in line with industry best practices. This will minimise the possibilities of misuse and also drive greater efficiencies that will eventually help our sellers and bring a wide and affordable selection of products to millions of customers on our platform,” the spokesperson said.

Title: 9.5L throng stalls as 10-day international trade fair ends
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

PATNA: More than 9.5 lakh people thronged different stalls at the 10-day-long India International Mega Trade Fair , a grand shopping festival at Gyan Bhavan here, which concluded on Monday. The trade fair featured both foreign and Indian products.

The fair witnessed rush of people on all 10 days. People were seen jostling to buy the variety of products from different countries and states ranging from food, handlooms, handicrafts, home décor, electronic gadgets and lifestyle. Traders from Iran and Afghanistan had also put up their stalls.

Shahzadi Khanam, a trader from Karnataka, said, “I make handicrafts and am thankful to Karnataka government for providing me the necessary support and incentives. It has been a wonderful experience here. Buyers in Patna are extremely humble.”

Buyers too were quite excited to shop at the fair. Dhirendra Mishra, a local, said he was amused to see good quality winter wear and other items at affordable prices. “I bought handlooms and some home décor items. My wife loved the cushion covers and lacy curtains,” he said.

Kushi Kumari, a college student, who was busy selecting tote bag, said, “The dress materials at Iran shop were too good. I just could not take my eyes off. I visited the fair thrice and bought food items, electronic gadgets and kurti with matching stoles,” she said.

The organisers said the fair was aimed at promoting small, micro and medium enterprises. “This fair has become one of the most awaited events in the country,” said one of the organisers.

Title: Ex-servicemen to observe Jan 14 as veterans’ day
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

PATNA: Bihar Ex-servicemen Officers’ Association (BESOA) will observe January 14 as the ‘Armed Force Veterans’ Day ’ to commemorate the selfless devotion and sacrifices of the veterans and strengthen their bond with serving personnel, BESOA coordinator Col (retd) V K Singh said on Monday.

Singh said Bihar had negligible welfare schemes for ex-servicemen as compared to Punjab, Haryana and Uttar Pradesh. “Though Bihar is second to Uttar Pradesh in giving about 11% manpower of its population to armed forces, most of the ex-servicemen still prefer to settle down in other states after retirement. Bihar seems to be the last choice for ex-servicemen to stay mainly due to poor facilities available in the state,” he said.

According to Col (retd) Singh, at least one lakh youths from Bihar are in the Army. They are sending Rs10 crore to 15 crore to their families in the state per month, which adds to the state economy. Indian Army is the fourth in the world in terms of numbers. Bihar, except lone Danapur cantonment, has virtually no Army station from military point of view. While there are three Regiments — Punjab, Sikh and Sikh Infantry in Punjab, even a small state like Uttarakhand has two regiments — Kumaon and Garhwal. Besides, Punjab and Uttarakahand have 20 regular battalions while Bihar has only one regiment, Singh said, adding that after bifurcation, Ramgarh cantonment is under Jharkhand and there is no Army station in Bihar located on the sensitive borders of Bangladesh and Nepal.

Though housing continues to be a major problem for ex-servicemen in Bihar, Albert Ekka memorial complex inaugurated by former President Pranab Mukherjee is lying in a dilapidated condition in Patna. Rajya and zila sainik kalyan karyalyas are also not functioning properly to benefit the ex-servicemen and war widows in the state . Process to appoint ex-servicemen as special auxiliary police (SAP) in Bihar has also been stopped for one reason or another, the BESOA coordinator said, adding ex-servicemen have thus no scope for re-employment in the state.

Col (retd) Singh reiterated the demand of Bihar ex-servicemen to build a suitable war memorial in Patna on the pattern of UP, West Bengal and Jharkhand in honour of the martyrs and ex-servicemen as “martyrs die not when they are shot, but when they are forgotten”.

Title: Flyovers banned for two-wheelers to save riders from manja injury in Surat
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

Youths enjoy the kite flying in Ahmedabad on Friday (File Photo)

SURAT: Police commissioner issued a notification on Monday banning two-wheelers for two days on flyovers in the city. This is a preventive step taken to safeguard the lives of people from suffering injuries by manja during kite flying by enthusiasts on the occasion of Uttarayan .

The notification says no two-wheelers will be allowed on the flyovers in the city on January 14 and 15. People are advised to use the ways below the flyovers, it added. At many places, people may have to face a lot of traffic but they would not complain because the notification is in their interest, citizens said.

“The sale of kites and manja has picked up in the last few days. Earlier, the sale was poor and the traders were crestfallen,” said a manja seller in Bhagal. There was huge rush in the shops in Bhagal of people keen to buy kites and manja for Uttarayan.

Title: Rain raises temperature, lightning kills Bikaner teen
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

Representative image

JAIPUR: Most places across the state witnessed a sudden change in climatic conditions on Monday with light to moderate showers lashing several areas. Lightning claimed the life of a teenager at Kakda village under Jasrasar police station area of Bikaner district.

The incident took place in Kakda village under Jasrasar police station area. The deceased, who was identified as Ashok Kumar (16), had taken shelter under a tree when it started raining. Kumar suffered severe burn injuries due to lightening and was rushed to a hospital in Nokha where doctors declared him brought dead.

Many places in Barmer, Jodhpur , Pali, Jaisalmer, Bikaner and Hanumangarh witnessed torrential rainfall. People in Hanumangarh and Bikaner witnessed drizzle that continued throughout the day in intervals.

Sriganganagar witnessed a rainfall of 31.4 mm and was followed by Jaisalmer with 13.7 mm, Phalodi (7.6mm) and Bikaner (5.4mm).

Meanwhile, cloudy conditions and increased the humidity guiding the mercury to take an upward swing across the state. People in Jaipur witnessed a minimum temperature of 11.4°C. Throughout the day, cloudy conditions prevailed across the city, but it did not convert into rainfall.

Kota remained coldest recording a minimum temperature of 8.0°C. It was followed by Bikaner at 9.5°C, Sriganganagar (9.9°C), Barmer (10.7°C), Ajmer (12.7°C), Churu (13.5°C)) and Jodhpur (17.5°C).

In its forecast, Jaipur Met office said foggy conditions would be witnessed during early morning hours which would be followed by a clear sky. “The speed of winds would be 18 to 28 km/hour above a height of 500 metres,” said an officer with the Met office.

Many places in the state especially in western Rajasthan also witnessed mild fog which affected the road and rail traffic.

Title: 61 arrested for flash protest against CAA, NRC at Towlichowki
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

Representative image

HYDERABAD: Golconda police arrested 61 persons for staging a protest against the Citizenship Amendment Act ( CAA ) and NRC at Towlichowki on Sunday night.

Around 100 protesters led by activist Khaleda Parveen gathered at Towlichowki cross roads around midnight and within minutes another group of women and youngsters joined them to raise slogans against CAA and NRC.

The sudden protest took the police by surprise and even though a large contigent of personnel were deployed they were unable to control the crowd and traffic at Towlichowki cross roads came to a stand still. Eventually, additional forces were pressed into service and the protesters were taken to Goshamahal stadium and later to Asifnagar police station.

“The protest did not have prior police permission and the gathering was unlawful. Hence, we have taken suo moto action against them and a case has been registered,” said inspector K Chandrasekhar Reddy of Golconda police station.

“The flash protests have an element of surprise so we have to be doubly alert,” said a senior police officer.

A case under IPC Sections 341 (wrongful restraint) and 290 (causing public nuisance) was also registered. The arrested persons were later released on bail.

The city has been witnessing several rallies in protest against CAA and National Register of Citizens (NRC) every day and the police are on their toes controlling the crowds.

Traffic cops also have their hands full as vehicle movement gets affected by the rallies that are taken out across the city.

Title: Sensex hits record 41.9k intraday
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

Mumbai: Sensex scaled a fresh all-time peak on Monday as global and domestic factors boosted investor sentiment. These were the progress on the US-China trade deal, positive index of industrial production (IIP) numbers for November, strong results by Infosys, fall in oil prices and strengthening of the rupee.

The sensex closed at 41,860, up 260 points for the day, after touching an all-time high at 41,900. The NSE Nifty too recorded a fresh high of 12,338 and closed at 12,330, up 73 points.

Dalal Street investors were enthused by the Dow Jones Index’s crossing the 29,000 mark for the first time in history on Friday and also the progress between the US and China to sign the first phase of the trade deal later this week, brokers said.

On the domestic front, the IIP for November showed an uptick of 1.8%, after showing negative growth for two consecutive months, brokers said. On Friday, Infosys kicked off the results season with a 24% jump in net profit for the October-December quarter that beat analysts’ expectations. In addition, the thawing of US-Iran tensions in the Middle East also helped the global crude oil prices come down to $65 per barrel level. This, in turn, helped the rupee strengthened from 70.94 to a dollar on Friday to 70.86 on Monday. The day’s gains, however, came on the back of muted net buying by domestic and foreign funds. BSE data showed that while FPIs recorded a net buying of Rs 68 crore, the corresponding figure for DIIs was Rs 47 crore. The day’s rally also added a little over Rs 1 lakh crore to investors’ wealth with BSE’s market capitalisation now at Rs 158.2 lakh crore.

Among the sensex stocks, Infosys, boosted by its strong result, rallied nearly 5% on Monday and contributed nearly half of the index’s gain. Other top contributors were IndusInd Bank and HUL. Among those which limited the gains were TCS, Reliance and ICICI Bank, all closing in the red.

Title: Bihar legislature ratifies Bill to extend SC/ST quota in lower Houses by 10 years
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

PATNA: Both Houses of the state legislature unanimously ratified the 126th Constitution Amendment Bill to extend reservation for SC/ST in the Lok Sabha and state assemblies by another 10 years.

The Bill was passed by the Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha on December 10 and 12, respectively, last year and it was required to be ratified by at least 50% of the state assemblies before its implementation. Accordingly, a special session of Bihar legislature was called for this purpose on Monday.

Following presentation of the Bill by Speaker Vijay Kumar Choudhary in the state assembly, deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi spoke on its different aspects and merits. “This law traces its roots to Poona Convention in 1932, which was attended by freedom fighters like Madan Mohan Malaviya. Later, it became an Act in 1935 and was implemented by the British government in 1937. But it was implemented for a short period of only two years and finally implemented in full-fledged manner with the enactment of the Constitution. It was proposed to remain effective for a period of 70 years, which is slated to expire on January 25, 2020,” SuMo said.

The deputy CM claimed that it was due to this provision of the Constitution that the 543-member Lok Sabha has 84 Scheduled Caste and 47 Scheduled Tribe members. He said since such reservation is not applicable to the 245-member Rajya Sabha, it has only 18 members from SC and eight from STs. “The number of SC/ST members in the Rajya Sabha could be 50-55, had there been a provision for their reservation in the Upper House of Parliament as well,” he said.

SuMo said the Bihar government also introduced reservation in promotion to SC and ST personnel in state services. “The matter is, however, pending in the Supreme Court,” he said.

Participating in the debate, leader of Opposition Tejashwi Prasad Yadav said a provision should be introduced to make reservation for SC/ST permanent in the Lok Sabha, instead of extending it every 10 years. He also raised the demand for calling a special session of the state legislature for conducting caste census and the corresponding resolution to be sent to the Centre. He added that RJD will not allow implementation of recently introduced Citizenship (Amendment) Act and National Register of Citizens (NRC) in Bihar.

Congress legislator party leader Sadanand Singh, on the other hand, said the provisions of the Bill ensure removal of disparity in the society. “Our nation builders understood that people belonging to SC/ST sections were deprived. Accordingly, provisions were made in the Constitution to ensure representation of people from SC/ST sections in Parliament. Congress supported this Bill in the Lok Sabha and we are doing the same here as well,” he said.

Later, chief minister Nitish Kumar said the Bill has already been passed by both Houses of Parliament and he was thankful to all the political parties in Bihar for supporting it in the state legislature.

After getting ratified in the state assembly, the Bill was presented in the state legislative council by its acting Chairperson Haroon Rashid and was approved following a voting on it.

Title: Two-week refresher course begins in Patna University
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

Patna University

PATNA: Patna University (PU) vice-chancellor (VC) Rash Bihari Prasad Singh on Monday called upon the teachers of physics to enrich the emerging disciplines of agrophysics and econophysics by utilizing their knowledge and create new vistas for human welfare.

Inaugurating a two-week refresher course on ‘Recent Advancement in Physical Sciences’ organized jointly by the PU UGC-HRD Centre and physics department, the VC said that physicists must devise ways for creating awareness in the society towards environmental protection and ecological balance. “The basic principles of physics may also be utilized in the field of social sciences for ameliorating the sufferings of human beings,” he added.

Speaking as the chief guest of the event, state information technology secretary Rahul Singh pointed out that India’s share in the field of qualitative research and patenting is less than 2%. He said, “A country becomes powerful only through its intellectual property. The universities and research organizations need to direct their attention towards generating more patents if India has to emerge as a hub of inventiveness.”

PU pro-VC Dolly Sinha said teachers should always work in the best interest of students and devote extra time in the process, if needed. She asked the teachers to teach a subject in such a manner that they evoke the students’ interest.

PU science faculty dean and Patna Science College principal S R Padmadeo pointed out that techniques of physics are gradually finding their way in biological sciences. “Works on protein and molecular genetics in biophysics could become possible only through the application of knowledge of physics,” Padmadeo said.

While PU physics department head Surabhi Prasad welcomed the guests, centre’s director Chandrama Singh proposed the vote of thanks.

Course coordinator Shankar Kumar said, “Altogether 40 physics teachers from different parts of the country are attending the course.”

Title: One male rhino dies in city zoo
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

PATNA: One male rhinoceros ‘Nagshanker’ died due to cardiac arrest at Sanjay Gandhi Biological Park, commonly known as Patna Zoo, on Monday. The zoo is now left with 11 rhinos, including six males and five females.

The 14-year-old rhino had come from Assam State Zoo-cum-Botanical Garden under an animal exchange programme on December 6 last year.

A group of five vets from Bihar Veterinary College and doctors of the zoo conducted the post-mortem of the deceased in the presence of zoo director Amit Kumar.

The preserved viscera samples of the animal were later sent to the Indian Veterinary Research Institute (IVRI)-Uttar Pradesh and Regional Diseases Diagnostic Laboratory (RDDL)-Kolkata for further tests.

After the post-mortem, the rhino was buried at a funeral ground near the Botanical Garden on the zoo premises.

The zoo director told this newspaper that the rhino was not suffering from any health ailments. “The main reason behind the death will be confirmed only after IVRI and RDDL conduct the tests,” he said.

A condolence meet was also held on the zoo premises.

Title: Cops record statement of Surat diamond baron
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

The statue was accidentally damaged and not vandalized, say cops

Rajkot: Surat diamond baron and promoter of multi-crore Hari Krishna Exports, Savji Dholakia , appeared before Lathi police in Amreli district in connection with the fake complaint of Mahatma Gandhi’s statue desecration that was lodged by his close aide on January 4.

Dholakia was summoned for questioning after spot examination and recovery of some audio clips which revealed that the statue was accidentally damaged by a tractor owned by the diamantaire’s NGO - Dholakia Foundation - several days before January 4. Kanak Patel, Dholakia’s aide, and others had allegedly created a fake crime scene and resorted to the drama of submitting a memorandum of the Amreli superintendent of police (SP) demanding immediate arrest of the vandals.

Police officials said that Dholakia could not produce any documents regarding permission taken to install this and many other statues surrounding the lake developed by the NGO near Lathi town.

Talking to TOI, Premsukh Delu, assistant superintendent of police, said, “Dholakia’s statement was recorded for three hours. He produced the document of the tractor which is owned by his father and driven by his labourer at the time of incident.”

“Dholakia claimed he had no knowledge of the fake complaint and the management of the lake is handled by Kanak Patel,” Delu said.

Police will now verify the call record details to verify Dholakia’s statement.

Dholakia told police that he had handed over a portion of the lake to the government after the development. He produced the documents of his land ownership of 100 bighas of the 200 bighas. “We will now ask district inspector of land records (DILR) to ascertain the portion of land encroached,” Delu said.

Police have still not registered a formal complaint regarding the furnishing wrong information to the public servant.

Title: Sebi gives top listed cos 2 more yrs to split CMD post
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

Mumbai: Markets regulator Sebi on Monday extended the deadline by two years to April 1, 2022 for the top 500 listed firms to separate the roles of chairman and MD/CEO. There was intense pressure from top corporates and PSUs — some even approached the finance ministry — to get the deadline pushed, despite Sebi giving them over two years to comply.

The rule was aimed primarily at improving the corporate governance structure of listed companies. The regulator wanted to separate the board and the management of the top 500 listed companies. In most of the developed world, these two are separate and the board oversees the management.

The rule was framed following recommendations by the Uday Kotak committee on corporate governance that was set up by Sebi in June 2017 and gave its final report in October of that year. In May 2018, Sebi had introduced the rule that required all the top 500 listed companies in India to separate the post of chairman, who should be non-executive, and the post of MD or CEO, who would be the top executive of the company. In several Indian companies, the chairman of the board is also the executive head of the company.

A gazette notification dated January 10 says the new date for implementing this rule is April 1, 2022 from the earlier deadline of April 1, 2020. According to data on the board structure of top 500 listed companies, nearly half have already separated the chairman and the MD/CEO posts. Despite opposition from some of the top corporate houses and some PSUs, recently two of the sensex companies announced their intentions about separation of the two posts.

On January 2, TOI reported that Wipro was on course to make the position of its chairman non-executive. Currently, Rishad Premji, from the promoter family, is the executive chairman of the company. In December, homegrown auto major Mahindra & Mahindra said that Anand Mahindra, currently the executive chairman, will give up his executive role on March 31, 2020.

However, Sebi has also been receiving several representations from corporates and industry trade bodies to postpone the rule due to higher compliance costs at a time when the economy is struggling.

Several top lawyers and industry bodies welcomed the decision. However, there were some who were not happy with it. Makarand Joshi, partner at corporate compliance firm MMJC & Associates, said that the companies that have implemented the change in board structure without waiting for the last date may feel that the postponement is unfair.

“The tendency to postpone any change in law has developed a habit among stakeholders to wait till the last date and see if there is any postponement or deferment. However, at times, such postponements of the last date also lead to duplication of efforts and a waste of time,” Joshi said.

Title: JD(U) cell to gift saplings to mothers of newborn girls
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

PATNA: Ruling JD(U)’s women cell on Monday decided to gift a sapling to the mother of every newborn girl child in rural areas with motivation to grow it in her neighbourhood in the name of her daughter.

“As per the decision, the village and panchayat-level volunteers of our women cell will henceforth approach all such mothers and convince them to raise saplings in the name of their newborn girls as the grown up tree will remain as memory after the daughter’s marriage,” JD(U)’s women cell state president Shweta Biswas told TOI while briefing about the resolution passed at state-level meeting held at JD(U) office here on Monday.

She said the cell has decided to execute this strategy only in villages because of the availability of saplings and free land in rural areas. “Moreover, majority of women in urban area are educated and they are aware about the need of environment protection and saving the girl child. We need to educate rural women,” Biswas, who is also an elected member of the Patna District Board, said.

In another resolution, the cell decided to ensure full participation of women in the proposed statewide human chain on January 19. “All district and block presidents of the cell have been given the task to convince women to participate in the formation of human chain,” she said.

Biswas said the JD(U) women cell has altogether 51 organizational districts in Bihar. The committees have so far been formed in 46 out of their 51 districts. The women cell presidents from 41 districts and dozens of state-level office-bearers attended the meeting.

JD(U) state general secretary Anil Kumar informed the participants about the Nitish government’s different schemes for women welfare.

Other prominent leaders who spoke on the occasion were Anjum Ara, Kiran Ranjan, Khushbu Kumari, Punam Jha and Veena Yadav.

After the meeting, the women leaders did a rehearsal outside the state JD(U) office on how to participate in the proposed human chain on January 19.

Title: Shop assistant replaces jewellery with fakes, ‘invests’ in gold loan firm
Content:
Representative image

KOLKATA: A week ago, on January 5, the owner of a reputable jewellery store chain approached Bhowanipore police after internal investigations showed that some gold ornaments in his store had been replaced by fakes. A week later, on Sunday, a salesman from the store was arrested for the crime.According to cops, Dum Dum resident Sanjib Chakraborty — who had been working at the store for seven months — had removed multiple gold items and “invested” them with a gold-loan firm. The cops are certain he was helped by others who made replicas of the originals. “We have taken Chakraborty into police custody and are questioning him on his modus operandi and other gang members,” said an officer.The store owner, Sumit Dutt, had complained that jewellery, including two gold chains, a couple of rings and buttons, had been replaced by fakes. During investigation, all employees of the jewellery shop were questioned for a prolonged period and the CCTV footage from the shop was examined minutely. But it was one ingenious step taken by the owner and senior staff that helped cops in the probe. “The customers often ask for the exact weight of the finished product. The management then began asking salespersons about the exact weight of the product they were selling to crosscheck if there was a gap between the actual weight and what was mentioned in the tag. Several items being sold by Chakraborty began showing serious differences,” explained an officer.Chakraborty’s statement, too, was contradictory. “His body language and certain postures recorded by the CCTV camera aroused suspicion and he was arrested. His house was searched, but, initially, nothing was recovered. After days of interrogation, he revealed the location of the ring — hidden in the prayer room, in a small envelope meant for homoeopathic medicine,” an officer said.“Chakraborty disclosed that the rest of the jewellery had been mortgaged by him at a gold loan finance firm. We have now seized his accounts,” said an officer.

Title: Oyo Layoffs: Oyo lays off 1,000, to focus on profitability
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

(File photo)

BENGALURU: Oyo founder Ritesh Agarwal has told staff that the focus of the company is on profitability as it is looks to balance “the speed of our growth with our operational capabilities” along with driving governance and leveraging technology to improve operations. The development comes as Oyo has started cost-cutting, laying off 10% of the Indian workforce, about 1,000 employees, according to sources briefed on the matter.

The development comes as the SoftBank-backed hospitality major has come under global scrutiny for the way it runs its operations, including overstating properties listed on its platform and alleged bribes. Oyo has also faced protests from hotel owners in India and China over payments. Over the last two years, Oyo has expanded aggressively to global markets including China, Europe and the US, armed with billions in funding from SoftBank Vision Fund .

“I have no hesitation in admitting that, growing at the pace at which Oyo has in the past few years, we sometimes went ahead of ourselves and pressure-tested our organisation at multiple levels. This year, we are taking steps to address this,” said the 26-year-old Agarwal in a mail to employees. He added that the company remains subject to external audits and is “making significant investments in compliance, training and governance”.

Agarwal said in his mail that “some roles at Oyo will become redundant as we further drive tech-enabled synergy, enhanced efficiency and remove duplication of effort across businesses or geographies”. “As a result, we are asking some of our impacted colleagues to move to a new career outside of Oyo.” While the total number of layoffs are currently pegged at 1,000, some reports have pegged it at over 2,000 employees in India out of a base of 20,000. Globally, Oyo employs over 20,000 and it is also expected to undertake layoffs in markets like China. TOI had reported about layoffs at Oyo and other unicorns on December 23.

The move could also see Oyo trimming its network of over 10,000 hotels in India as the focus will be on “profitable locations and buildings and avoid growth that dilutes our margins” and reducing “operating costs”.

Oyo Hotels & Homes reported losses of Rs 1,308 crore for the first three months of the current financial year ending in June, according to a valuation report filed with the Registrar of Companies (RoC). For the financial year ending March 2019, it reported a net loss of Rs 2,384 crore compared to Rs 360 crore a year ago. During this period, the company’s revenue grew to Rs 6,456 crore as against Rs 1,413 crore at the end of March 2018.

Title: Shahjahanpur: Tanker turns turtle, villagers rush in to collect spilled edible oil
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

BAREILLY: Villagers in UP’s Shahjahanpur scrambled with canisters, buckets, utensils to fill up spilled edible oil after a tanker turned turtle on Farrukhabad- Bareilly state highway in Allahaganj area of Shahjahanpur district on Monday.

The tanker truck, carrying refined edible oil, was coming from Maharashtra and heading to Rudrapur in Uttarakhand. Police arrived at the spot nearly an hour late and dispersed the chaotic crowd with their oil-filled vessels. Such tankers usually have a capacity to carry around 30,000 litres of edible oil.

The accident occurred at 8 am when the tanker driver, identified as Rohit Kumar, driving slowly due to dense fog lost control of his vehicle after being hit by a speeding truck. The tanker soon turned turtle on the road after the collision. The other truck driver fled the scene leaving Kumar still stuck inside the driver’s cabin. On hearing a loud noise, a few locals arrived and rescued Kumar, who received some bruises on his hand. But, before Kumar could settle down, several villagers, including women and children, rushed towards the tanker and started filling the spilled oil into their empty vessels.

LK Mishra, a local, who was returning to Shahjahanpur from Rajasthan , informed police. But, the police arrived much later. Mishra told TOI, “The accident took place at 8 am near Gora and Sugsugi villages. The driver was alone in the tanker and couldn’t save the oil spill. The dial 112 team came for rescue after an hour while the local SHO didn’t even answer our repeated phone calls.”

An elderly person from a nearby village said, “The spilled over edible oil, though contaminated, can always be used along with fodder for cattle. I’ve heard that most of the villagers had grabbed pure oil directly from the tanker which can be used for cooking food.”

The tanker driver narrated, “I was on my way to Rudrapur to deliver refined edible oil when I met with an accident. After the accident, over 50 villagers arrived and started taking away the spilled oil in their vessels. I couldn’t do anything apart from informing the cops and the tanker owner. The villagers threatened to thrash me when I tried to stop some of them. Police arrived late. We have asked the police to file an FIR against the speeding truck driver and the villagers for the loot.”

Police, however, were yet to file an FIR till late in the evening. SHO Sudhakar Pandey said that he did not receive any written complaint from the truck driver.

Title: ICAI holds CFO Meet
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

Nagpur: The Nagpur Branch of Institute of Chartered Accountants of India (ICAI) organised a programme— CFO Meet — in the city recently. ICAI formed a committee for members of the industry and business to establish links between ICAI and chartered accountants who are employed in the industry.

The move aims to provide chartered accountants a base of reference in terms of knowledge, expertise, skills as well as give them assistance through establishing an intensive relationship with various stakeholders of the industry, said a press release issued by the Nagpur branch of ICAI.

“Chartered accountants in an industry or service sector are an integral part of the entity and they ensure optimum financial stability and security to various stakeholders,” said former ICAI president Jaydeep Shah. He was the chief guest during the function.

The confidence of the business promoters and the financial agencies, including creditors, is catered to by the chartered accountants, Shah said.

With the increasing burden of compliance under various types of laws, it is imperative for business houses to appoint chartered accountants. Banking is a sector which employs maximum number of chartered accountants to ensure financial scrutiny of proposals as well as ensure financial security of the lending agency, he said.

Title: Telangana: Now, students to get lessons on CAA, NRC
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

Demonstrators holding during a rally to protest against CAA, NRC and NPR in Hyderabad (ANI file photo)

HYDERABAD: Students of at least seven schools and colleges in Tolichowki are set to learn about the Citizenship Amendment Act ( CAA ) and National Register of Citizens (NRC) as a group of volunteers has taken up the task to educate young students on the subject.

Many schools in Tolichowki, Shaikpet and Old City areas are opening their doors to these volunteers, who are also launching flash protests against CAA and NRC across the city. “We will be giving a presentation on CAA and NRC in these institutions. We will inform the venue an hour prior to the programme and as a precautionary measure, we cannot disclose the names of these institutions,” said a volunteer.

Even the Telangana Private Schools Joint Action Committee, which has close to 400 schools as members, has decided to educate students about CAA and NRC and its repercussions.

Meanwhile, even BJP’s Telangana unit is conducting events in colleges to inform students about the Act. Recently, Raghunandan Rao Madhavaneni, BJP’s official spokesperson, delivered a lecture on ‘Why India needs NRC’ at Aurora PG College in Ramanthapur.

Title: Man, wife suffocate to death in Jaipur
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

Representative image

JAIPUR: A man and his wife, who went to sleep in a room where a coal heater was burning, died of suffocation in Bhatta Basti area late on Sunday night. It is second such case in 15 days from the city. On December 30, two labourors had suffocated to death in the same manner while sleeping with lit coal heater.

Salauddin (32) and Nikhat Parveen went to sleep around 8.30pm on Sunday night. Since it was a cold evening, the couple decided to light a coal heater and put it inside the room and closed the doors. “When Salauddin’s brother knocked on the door at 11pm, nobody responded. When he forcefully opened the door, he found the couple dead,” said Mahaveer Singh Meena, additional commissioner of police, Shastri Nagar.

Title: Can’t refund money paid to MS Dhoni, SC told
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

Supreme Court

NEW DELHI: Sports management company Rhiti Sports, which was asked to refund Rs 42 crore paid by Amrapali Group as endorsement fee for M S Dhoni , told the Supreme Court on Monday that it had already paid Rs 37 crore to the cricketer and it should not be directed to refund the money .

Referring to SC-appointed forensic auditors’ report that Amrapali Group indulged in “sham” agreements to divert money to the sports marketing & management company, the homebuyers had sought SC’s direction to the cricketer and the company to refund the money that would be used for construction of unfinished housing projects of the Group in which more than 45,000 buyers had put in money.

Opposing the plea, senior advocate Mukul Rohatgi, appearing for Rhiti Sports, told a bench of Justices Arun Mishra and U U Lalit that the company was just managing endorsement rights of Dhoni and R Ashwin and it had already paid the money to the cricketers through cheque and asked how could it be directed to refund the money. The bench, thereafter, asked home-buyers’ lawyer M L Lahoty to file its response on application filed by the company.

Title: Uttarakhand governmet mulls ban on mobile inside college classrooms
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

Dhan Singh Rawat

DEHRADUN: Higher education minister Dhan Singh Rawat on Monday said that the state government is mulling a ban on the use of mobile phones inside classrooms during classes in all colleges.

In order to facilitate this, the government will conduct a poll to ask students whether they feel that mobiles should be allowed in the classrooms or not, the minister said.

“If 51 per cent students vote for a mobile ban in classrooms, we will ban the use of phones,” he said, adding that parents as well as teachers in colleges keep on expressing their concerns over excessive use of mobile phones by students in classrooms, which is why they were going to conduct the survey.

“We are a democratic country that is undergoing IT revolution, so, there is no point in curtailing people’s freedom. But we aim to ensure that students remain focused at least during 40 minutes of their class. Mobiles do cause distractions. And this fact is undeniable,” Rawat told TOI.

The higher education minister further said, “We still feel that students will only decide whether they want to carry mobile to classrooms in colleges or not. Hence, our poll will be helpful to understand their points of view.”

Rawat also acknowledged the fact that preparations were needed to ensure that mobiles are kept safely in colleges. “We will have to provide lockers outside classes, if students want a mobile ban in classes. Or else, we will have to ask students to keep their phones switched off. Whatever it is, we will plan accordingly after taking the suggestions from students,” he added.

Welcoming the higher education minister’s announcement, Ajay Saksena, principal of DAV College in the city, said that mobiles used by students often cause distraction — not just for students, but teachers as well. “At times, even teachers get disturbed due to mobile calls and rings. I feel it will be a good move if mobiles are banned during classes,” he said.

When asked why students cannot be simply told to switch off or put their phones on silent modes in classrooms, Saksena said, “Government kept on saying that smoking in public places is unethical. But did it have the desired effect? Only when smoking in public places was banned, people started becoming more cautious.”

Title: 20 people in touch with accused on police radar
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

Representative image

THIRUVANANTHAPURAM: More than 20 people in the state, who are believed to be in constant touch with the culprits involved in the shooting of a police officer at Kaliyikkavila checkpost , are under the scanner of the police.

Even though the state police are not involved in the case as the deceased police officer belonged to the Tamil Nadu police, the state police are helping the Tamil Nadu police to track the culprits in the case. “On the basis of their phone records, more than 20 people are under the scanner of the police. Those who were picked by the Tamil Nadu police from Thenmala on Sunday are those who were in close contact with the culprits,” sources said.

Four people were taken into custody at Thenmala on Sunday, by Q branch of Tamil Nadu police with the help of the state police. Sources said that it is suspected that religious fundamentalists are behind the job and the probe has a nationwide scope. “The state police are only a part of the case. The probe is being conducted in Bengaluru and Delhi as well,” sources said. The police are closely liaising not only with Tamil Nadu police, but police from other states to where the probe has been extended. “This could either be a random act or an act that is in retaliation to some incident,” sources added.

Last Wednesday, special sub-inspector in Tamil Nadu police Y Wilson was shot dead at the Tamil Nadu side of the Kaliyikkavila checkpost.

The police received information that two youths — Thoufeeq and Abdul Shameem — who were radicalised are behind the act.

Title: Pune: Couple under financial stress found dead in flat
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

Representative image

PUNE: A married couple was found dead in their flat at Shastri chowk in Bhosari on Tuesday morning, in a case of suspected murder-suicide. A note recovered from the house indicated that the couple was under financial stress.

The man, Anil Deshmukh (32), was found hanging from the ceiling fan while his wife, Priyanka (27), was found dead nearby.

The couple has a seven-year-old daughter who had stayed the night with Priyanka’s friend and got to know her parents were no more only in the morning. The girl has been entrusted to the care of Priyanka’s brother. The police have registered a case under charges of murder and suicide.

“Based on a note recovered from the spot and preliminary post-mortem findings, we suspect that Deshmukh first strangled his wife to death and then hanged himself late on Monday night,” senior inspector Shankar Awatade of the Bhosari police told TOI.

Awatade said the note, purportedly written by Deshmukh, was addressed to his late mother. “I am sending your daughter-in-law to you; I am also coming,” the note read.

The note highlighted that Deshmukh and his wife were going through financially hard times, which also was the reason for the frequent quarrels between them, the police said. “Deshmukh was unemployed for the past two years, while Priyanka worked for an automobile showroom,” Awatade said.

The family had moved into the rented flat, located on Alandi Road, a few months ago. Deshmukh was from Indore and Priyanka from Amravati. Theirs was a love marriage. He had earlier worked with a private company in Chakan, police said.

Awatade said Priyanka would frequently let her daughter stay at her friend’s house. The girl was unwell on Monday night but still went to stay with her mother’s friend.

“Late in the night, neighbours heard the couple quarrelling over their financial situation. We suspect that in a fit of rage, Deshmukh throttled her before hanging himself,” Awatade said.

On Tuesday morning, Priyanka’s friend called her several times and, when she got no answer, came to the flat. “She knocked on the door several times and later alerted a neighbour, who called the police,” Awatade said.

The police broke open the door and found Priyanka lying motionless on the floor with Deshmukh hanging from the ceiling fan. “The couple was rushed to hospital where they were declared brought dead,” Awatade said.

Title: Medical students, doctors stage protest at Unani hospital campus
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

Protesters at Unani hospital campus in the city on Monday

HYDERABAD: Medical students and doctors of Government Nizamia Unani Hospital, Charminar , staged protests on the college campus on Monday, in solidarity with students of Jamia Millia Islamia and declaring their anti-Citizenship (Amendment) Act ( CAA ) stance.

Nearly 200 doctors, holding placards, demanded immediate arrest of people who attacked students at Jamia. They also said their peaceful protest would continue till NRC and CAA are rolled back by the Centre.

Ibrahim Mohammed, a post-graduate student, said they would be sitting outside the library from 3pm to 9pm now on and even study in the open, as a mark of protest.

“We fear that if attacks had been carried out on students at Jamia and JNU, it can also happen on us one day. We may come under attack from goons and the way police is acting, there is hardly any reason to believe it will not spread to other colleges and universities. They don’t want the voice of the youth to come out and hence they are attacking students,” Syeda Husna Fatima, a fourth-year under-graduate (UG) student, said.

Zubair Alam, a UG final year student, meanwhile, said the medical fraternity has been attacked at JNU when the ambulance with doctors in it was vandalised. “This bill by the government is not only unconstitutional but also irrational. They are asking for documents from citizens and want to allow refugees from Pakistan , Afghanistan and Bangladesh without any documentation,” he said.

Title: Farmer suicides in Telangana: Ex gratia continues to elude families
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

Representative image

HYDERABAD: District level committee reports to confirm whether a farmer committed suicide due to agricultural losses are being delayed in Telangana due to which the families of the farmers are failing to get ex gratia on time.

A Right to Information Act reply revealed a huge delay in the committee reports. While NCRB says farmers suicides increased in Telangana, the government machinery has been failing to act fast to clear the ex gratia for farmers.

Rythu Swarajya Vedika activist Kondal Reddy told TOI,” We can understand if the three-member committee report is delayed by a few months, but in several cases, the report is pending for the past five years. In Warangal Urban district three cases of farmer suicides are pending for verification by a three-member committee.”

The RTI reply revealed that D Chandra Rao of Devenur in Dharamasagar mandal of Warangal Urban committed suicide on October 9, 2015, but the status is ‘Three-member committee report under process’. Similar cases include those of Sandaraju Sudhakar of Nagaram in Hasanparthy mandal and Mittapally Raju of Elukurthy of Dharmasagar mandal who ended their life in October 2015.

Another anomaly is that Yadadri Bhongir district officials are delaying payment of Rs 1 crore ex gratia to 18 families although the entire process is done.

“For the past three to four years, Yadadri district is not handing over the ex gratia amount. How can a district have Rs 1 crore? Each family was granted Rs 6 lakh,” said Kondal Reddy.

Families of farmers are also facing similar issues in Andhra Pradesh. “In Kurnool, only 14 farmers were given ex gratia after YS Jagan Mohan Reddy’s government came into power . However, after the government came into power, around 62 farmers ended life till October 7. When will the government do justice to other farmers?” questioned Kondal Reddy.

Title: Tusker owned by BJP MLA tramples mahout to death
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

bizarre turn of events

Gorakhpur: An elephant, owned by Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) MLA from Gorakhpur (rural) Vipin Singh, trampled its mahout to death in Singhpur village, under Jangha police station, on Monday. Police said the tusker and the mahout, Shabbir (34), were returning from a hawan in Deoria.

The body has been sent for an autopsy.

Police lodged a complaint submitted by Shabbir’s family members. Station house officer of Jangha police station Anil Kumar Singh said, “BJP MLA Vipin Singh has said that he would help the mahout’s family in every possible way.”

The elephant, Ganga Ram, was trained and was looked after by cousin duo Shabbir and Asim. On Monday while returning from Deoria, the two mahouts stopped at Singhpur village to rest. When Asim went to attend nature’s call, Shabbir stood on the elephant’s back to pluck leaves from a Peepal tree to feed Ganga Ram. However, as soon as Shabbir sat down, the elephant held him with his trunk and threw him down with force. He then trampled him to death.

Title: Telangana: Driver misbehaves with airline employee, held
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

Representative image

HYDERABAD: A car driver was arrested for allegedly misbehaving with an airlines employee at Shamshabad on Saturday morning. The incident happened when the victim was en route to work.

According to police, the victim , a 21-year-old woman from Shamshahad, works at the Rajiv Gandhi International (RGI) Airport.

Around 7.25am, the victim left her house and reached Shamshabad bus station to get into a vehicle to reach the airport. “She stood near Sangeeta mobile showroom looking for transport to report her workplace. Meanwhile, a taxi driver stopped his vehicle near her and started calling passengers intending to go to the airport to get in,” RGI Airport inspector P Vijay Kumar said.

The victim was the only passenger, who boarded the car. “After starting the car, the driver asked for Rs 150 to drop her at the airport. However, the victim said she will give Rs 120 and the accused insisted that she should pay the full amount. The victim then offered to give a chocolate for the balance amount. The car driver then mistook what she said and misbehaved by touching her. The victim then asked the driver to stop the car and raised an alarm. With other people on the road noticing him, the accused stopped the car at Pulla Reddy Sweets on the airport approach road and forced the victim to disembark from his vehicle. He fled from the spot,” the inspector said.

Based on a complaint of the victim, police analysed CCTV camera footage and arrested the car driver, Mohammed Samyuddin, on Sunday.

Title: ED to attach assets of J P Morgan
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

Enforcement Directorate

NEW DELHI: The Supreme Court on Monday allowed the Enforcement Directorate to proceed against Mauritius-based firm JP Morgan and attach its properties for taking away Rs 140 crore of Amrapali homebuyers ’ money through alleged shady transactions in violation of FEMA and the Companies Act.

A bench of Justices Arun Mishra and U U Lalit directed the agency to take action against the firm to recover the amount without waiting for its order and bring the probe against the company to a logical conclusion. The apex court had ordered ED probe against J P Morgan after holding that the Rs 85 crore investment by the firm in Amrapali Group through FDI and taking away Rs 140 crore by selling its shares to shell companies at inflated value was a ploy to divert homebuyers’ money overseas.

The apex court accepted the findings of SC-appointed forensic auditors who concluded that the investment made by J P Morgan was in violation of Foreign Exchange Management Act (FEMA) and Companies Act in connivance with Amrapali Group. The report had said that the firm had sold its shares worth of Rs 140 crore to two companies—Rudraksh and Neelkanth— whose directors at that time were peons of the Amrapali Group.

A senior ED official said the agency will soon initiate proceedings under PMLA against both Amrapali and JP Morgan and the latter’s assets equivalent to Rs 140 crore can be attached in India. The ED need not file a separate case against JP Morgan as its PMLA case against Amrapali, where JP Morgan is an accused, is sufficient to attach the company’s assets.

J P Morgan had refuted the allegation of violation of any law in investing in Amrapali Group and later on selling its stake. But the bench had rejected its plea and held that FEMA rules prohibited transactions route adopted by the company to invest in Amrapali. “We are in agreement with the findings of the forensic auditors in this regard,” it had said.

Title: Kalla panel has little info on contract staff
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

Jaipur: Even after more than a year into governance, the Kalla committee constituted to suggest means to regularize contract employees has not been able to get the details of contract employees posted at various departments.

The Congress in its manifesto had announced that it would find a way to regularize the employees working on contract basis. The chief minister immediately after assuming office had constituted a cabinet sub-committee under the chairmanship of senior minister Dr B D Kalla to look in to the issue.

The subcommittee had several meetings in the last one year but every time it was said that some departments had not furnished the details of the employees in their departments and will write to the department.

Title: Oyo-like app to check into women’s hostels soon
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

Kochi: Women travellers looking for safe stay in Kerala would soon be able to book hostel rooms using an Oyo-like app being developed by the Kerala State Womens’ Development Corporation ( KSWDC ).

The corporation is also working towards developing a set of standards for women hostels in the state to provide better user experience.

KSWDC has already identified 160 hostels in the state —both public and private— which they intent to partner with, as part of the Stay Safe project. “The idea is to bring all the hostels under one app to provide safe night-stay to women who travel,” said Bindu V C, managing director, KSWDC.

The aggregator platform would give more visibility to the hostels and also enable easy booking as women won’t have to physically scout around for vacant hostel rooms. KSWDC has invited expression of interest from startups registered under Kerala Startup Mission for developing the app which will have the ability to identify nearby hostels from the current user location. The app would list out available hostel rooms and facilities based on date and location. Users would also have the ability to rate previous bookings they have made.

KSWDC officals said though they have shortlisted 160 hostels only 60 of them have provided them the details. “An initial meeting was attended by representatives of 30 hostels. Once we identify all the hostels we will set standards for the rooms on offer and then enter into an agreement with them,” said a KSWDC official.

The corporation wants all partner hostels to have facilities comparable to hotel rooms including attached bathrooms, towels, napkins and toiletry articles like soap. KSWDC has not looked into restrictions imposed by hostels on inmates. “The whole point is to make the experience safe for women who travel at night. So such restrictions won’t work,” the official said.

For government facilities there would be a centralised tariff system while for private hostel rooms the rate shall be defined with a cap as set by KSWDC. The plan is to pilot the project using a dedicated helpline number before shifting aggregation and boooking to the app, sources said.

Title: Cong slams Maya’s no-show
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

Varanasi: Targeting BSP supremo Mayawati for skipping the meeting of opposition parties called by Congress over CCA and NRC, UPCC president Ajay Singh Lallu alleged that Mayawati is close to BJP, and she has nothing to do with the problems of people.

Lallu was here to attend the meeting of Congress office-bearers and workers on Monday. Talking to reporters, he accused Mayawati of dancing to BJP’s tune because of the fear of CBI and ED. By distancing herself from the opposition meeting for protecting the Constitution, she showed that she is going against the dream of Baba Saheb Ambedkar, he said adding that it is a clear indication that she is working hand in glove with the BJP.

Training his gun at Yogi Adityanath government over the introduction of police commissioner system, he said it would not work for improving law and order in the state unless the intention of the government as well as police is correct.

Title: 6 workers hurt in steel factory blast, 2 critical
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

Hyderabad: Six workers suffered burns in a blast at a steel company at Subhash Nagar in Jeedimetla industrial area on Sunday night. Two of the injured are in a critical condition.

The accident took place at Jayaraj Steel Company on Sunday night. “The mishap occurred at the furnace when melted iron leaked and fell in water surrounding it, triggering an explosion of steam,” Balanagar ACP K Purushotham said.

At that time, six workers were trying to fix a crane at the factory. “As the workers were standing 20 feet above the furnace, they directly came in contact with the steam and sustained burns,” the ACP said. tnn

Title: JD(S) to expedite merger talks with LJD
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

Thiruvananthapuram: The Janata Dal (Secular) state unit will resume negotiations with the Loktantrik Janata Dal (LJD) regarding their proposed merger after January 17. The decision was taken at the JD(S) state committee meeting held here on Monday.

The meeting witnessed heated debates over the issue with a section of leaders raising doubts over lack of transparency in the process. According to sources, Thiruvananthapuram district committee chief Firoz Lal and Kannur district president PP Divakaran demanded transparency by taking into confidence district president and state committee members regarding the merger talks. Divakaran said all those who had taken the lead to form JD(S) when the party was split should be included in the talks. It was decided that the final decision would be taken only with the concurrence of the state committee.

State president CK Nanu told the leadership panel that a committee comprising minister K Krishnankutty, Mathew T Thomas MLA, A Neelalohitadas and him is leading the talks. He said MP Veerendra Kumar and MV Sreyams Kumar of LJD had already held discussions with JD(S) national president HD Deve Gowda. Krishnankutty told the committee that Gowda entrusted the panel to negotiate with LJD leadership when he met them at Kottakkal on December 24.

Sources said a few leaders also raised questions over the demand by LJD for eight district president posts. Leaders including Thomas said discussions should be transparent and JD (S) should demand more positions during merger.

The national leadership of JD(S) has asked state leadership to reach a consensus within the party and reach an agreement with LJD before submitting the merger formula to them. Efforts are on to complete the procedure at the earliest as the state would soon switch to panchayat election mode.

Ends…

Title: Uttarakhand: Met predicts more rain, snow in coming days
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

DEHRADUN: Most places in Uttarakhand received light to moderate rainfall and areas above 2,500m witnessed a good spell of snowfall on Monday.

Weather conditions are expected to improve from Tuesday onwards. Another spell of rain, snow has been predicted for Uttarakhand for a period of three days starting from July 16.

The warning issued by Indian Meteorological Department for January 13 and 16 reads, “Rain/snow accompanied by thunderstorm, lightning and hailstorm will take place at isolated locations.” The peak activity of the spell over the western Himalayan regions and plains of northwest India has been predicted for January 13 and 16. Sharing the information, director of Regional Met Centre Bikram Singh said, “There is a prediction of light to moderate rainfall in the plains and snowfall at a height of over 2,500m between January 13 and 16.”

Meanwhile, overcast conditions engulfed the entire state in the afternoon hours of Monday. Around late afternoon, it started raining at most places in the hill state, including Dehradun and Mussoorie, whereas higher reaches, including Yamunotri and Auli witnessed snowfall.

Singh added that for the next two days, people need to stay a little cautious. “However, the rains would be light to moderate in nature,” he said.

Title: State election commission to buy 7,560 EVMs
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

Representative image

JAIPUR: The state election commission (SEC) has issued an order for the purchase of 7,560 units of multi-post single vote electronic voting Machines (EVMs) from Electronics Corporation of India Limited (ECIL) at Rs 25,150 per unit. The total cost for the purchase of EVMS is Rs 19.01 crore.

Each unit of EVM include one control unit (CU) along with one Secured Detachable Memory Module (SDMM) and two ballot units (BUs). Each control unit (CU) will cost Rs 9,904 and two ballot units will cost Rs 15,246 (2X7,623).

Title: Traffic rules not on the menu of Chennai’s food delivery agents
Content:
More than 22,000 cases have been booked against online food delivery executives in the past six months for vio... Read More

CHENNAI: Ordering food online may be a matter of a few taps for the customer, but delivering the parcel is anything but a smooth 30-minute bike ride for the assigned executive. He may be speeding, jumping signals or hurtling down the wrong lane to hand you over a packet before getting ready for more orders.More than 22,000 cases have been booked against online food delivery executives in the past six months for violating traffic rules. Cases include riding on the wrong side, taking unauthorised U-turns, speeding, using mobile phones while riding and not wearing helmets.The Chennai traffic police say they have intensified checks and organised special drives to rein in offenders. Sources said police keep meeting delivery staff and representatives from Swiggy, Zomato, Uber Eats, Food Panda and other online food aggregators every two months. And while compliance may go up after such efforts, violations are too common.Additional commissioner of police, traffic, A Arun said food delivery executives were “hardworking people” . “But we book cases as we are concerned about their lives,” he replied when asked about violations.Last December, Satta Panchayat Iyakkam (SPI), a Chennai-based NGO, did an independent study in the city to ascertain the reason behind rampant violations. Teams were stationed on Old Mahabalipuram Road, Kamarajar Road, Anna Salai and Jawaharlal Nehru Road (Alandur-Koyambedu), and in Velachery and Thiruvanmiyur. A total of 375 executives were observed of whom nearly 65% committed at least one traffic offence.In a similar survey in 2018, riding without a helmet was the most common violation. But compliance was better in 2019, said the study. This can be primarily attributed to strict enforcement by police following the Madras high court ’s direction on the use of helmets.Riding down the wrong side or ignoring no-entry signs were among the most common offences in the 2019 study. This was attributed to the tight deadline for delivery executives, challenging incentive-based wage system and their unfamiliarly with routes.“We have to finish 25 to 30 deliveries a day to earn an incentive of Rs 14,000 per month. This means we have to work for at least 14 to 15 hours a day. We hardly get any breathing space between two consecutive orders,” said Sadish, a Swiggy delivery partner.Ratings from play a crucial role. For instance, a delivery staff with 4.8 or 4.9 rating out of 5 gets more bookings. “Even if we are late by two minutes, customers get annoyed and give us poor ratings. We are forced to rush. Sometimes, even if it is the hotel’s fault, we face the consequences,” Sadish said.Renga Prasad from SPI, who led the study, said, “Instead of penalising them, companies can adopt simple steps like printing grievance numbers on bikes, providing incentives for safe driving and adding road safety modules as a part of induction programmes.”While Swiggy refused to comment, Zomato said its staff are available to “segregate joinees (based on their behaviour and psychology), train them on safety measures and ensure that they wear their t-shirts and helmets while working.” As far as delivery time is concerned, there is no fixed deadline as estimated time of arrival changes with traffic conditions.A senior official from the state labour department said home delivery has emerged as a “huge industry” and efforts will be made to regulate it.

Title: Youth killed in bike-truck collision
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

Allahabad: An unidentified youth was killed and another was injured when a truck rammed the motorcycle they were riding near Nanmai village, under the limits of Kokhraj police station, on Monday afternoon.

The driver of the truck managed to flee the scene leaving the truck behind on Allahabad –Kanpur highway.

Kaushambi police said the youth who was driving died on the spot and the condition of the pillion rider is critical. The injured youth was undergoing treatment at the district hospital.

Police also said the truck which rammed the bike has been seized and they were looking for the accused driver.

Title: Hyderabad News - Times of India
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

SCR inks pact with SBI

South Central Railway entered into a Memorandum of Understanding with State Bank of India (SBI) in connection with Doorstep Banking for direct pickup of earnings covering all 585 railway stations over SCR. The MoU was signed on Monday by SCR and SBI officials at SCR headquarters, Rail Nilayam, Secunderabad in the presence of Gajanan Mallya, general manager, SCR. The direct pick up of cash from all railway stations as per the MoU dispenses with the tedious movement of cash earnings through ‘Cash Safes’ by trains.

TITA conducts coding training

Telangana Information Technology Association (TITA) held a six-day pilot training on introducing coding skills at school level. TITA members trained 54 participants from 18 government schools in Makthal constituency of Wanaparthy district.

SCR employees bag awards

Gajanan Mallya, general manager, South Central Railway presented “Man of the Month” safety awards to 14 employees for being alert on duty and taking timely action to prevent unsafe conditions. He presented the awards during the safety meeting held on Monday at Rail Nilayam, Secunderabad along with principle heads of departments.

Sankranti fest at Shilparamam

Shilparamam hosted ‘Sankranthi Festival’ celebrations at Uppal Mini Shilparamam from Monday. Several folk cultural performances were organised. Sri Vaikuntam Group performed Gussadi dance representing Adilabad district. Kum G Sharanya from California performed Bharatnatyam. Students of Musunoori Academy of Dance And Music performed Gobbila Patalu dance and a Kuchipudi dance recital.

Title: Ajmer: Mother held for dumping newborn girl
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

Representative image

AJMER: Police on Monday arrested the woman who dumped her newborn girl in a bush on January 2 leading to her death.

The woman delivered the baby in the house of her relative at nearby Nausar village. Police said after the body of the newborn was found, probe started and later it was found that Ameena (22), a resident of Jaswantpura village in Kharwa, came for delivery in her relatives’ place and later vanished from the village.

Title: Upgrading reservoirs, lakes essential for cultivation in hills: CM
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

Dehradun: Laying thrust on the need to encourage farming in the hills, CM Trivendra Singh Rawat on Monday said that it was important to focus on the water resources in the tough terrains. He laid thrust on the need to develop water bodies, which could be used for the purpose of irrigation.

For boosting the agriculture sector in the hills, he stressed on cluster-based farming, value addition and certification of organic products.

While addressing an event organised by NABARD on Monday, Rawat said that culture-based farming and organic farming were important to double farmers’ income. He added that Uttarakhand was a state of tough geographical conditions and most places are not irrigated. “Gravity-based irrigation and drinking water is a suitable solution for which we need to develop water bodies. Keeping in mind, the drying water sources, water conservation has become extremely crucial in the state. We are making efforts to rejuvenate rivers and developing lakes in Pithoragarh, Champawat, Almora, Pauri, Chamoli, Dehradun and other districts and it will help in the long run,” said the CM.

NABARD has assessed the credit potential of Rs 24,656 crore for the overall development of Uttarakhand for the year 2020-21. Of this, there is an agricultural credit potential of Rs 11,802 crore.

Rawat added that to provide assistance to the agri sector, the state government was giving an interest-free loan up to Rs 1 lakh for the farmers.

Title: Education takes a hit as 55% posts lying vacant in Kota’s RTU
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

The RTU entrance in Kota

KOTA: The non-availability of teaching staff in Rajasthan Technical University ( RTU ) has raised a question mark on the seriousness of the consecutive governments in imparting technical education.

Fifty five percent posts, both teaching as well as non-teaching, are lying vacant in the university. As per figures, RTU has a strength of 283 teaching and non-teaching staff against the sanctioned posts of 643. It has overburdened several departments which are neither teaching properly nor carrying out any research project.

Reports said that university had been inviting applications for recruitment since 2011 but withholding the process repeatedly. The only exception was 2014 when 60 candidates were recruited.

Ironically, the university has generated revenue of Rs 1.05 crore from 36,230 candidates who applied for various posts with examination fee for recruitment between 2011 and 2018.

The information sought through Right to Information (RTI) by Kota-based activist Sujeet Swami revealed that 63% posts of teaching staff in the university is lying vacant.

All 25 posts in the Petrochemical, Information Technology and MBA courses are lying vacant

Against 37 sanctioned posts of professors, only 10 posts are filled, while 27 are vacant. Similarly, only 19 associate professors are working against the sanctioned posts of 68. There are 67 assistant professors against the sanctioned posts of 156.

The picture of non-teaching staff is also dismal as 195 are vacant against 382 sanctioned posts, with occupancy on only 187 posts, including the significant posts of examination controller, director, dean, student welfare and accountant.

The RTI information also revealed the university had invited applications for filling various sanctioned posts in 2011, 2013, 2014 and 2018. However, it held back the recruitment process after charging examination fees from the applicants.

Title: Youth festival to bust exam stress from February 1
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

Representative image

KOTA: The prelims of Kota Carnival (KOCA), which was conceptualised by Kota district collector Om Kesera to offer coaching students with opportunities to exhibit their talents in extra curriculur activities, was held at Rangmanch in Deshurra Maidan on Sunday.

The two-day event would kick-off on February 1 with around 2 lakh coaching students expected to participate.

The theme has been designed with a view to provide a stress-free environment to coaching students in addition to giving them an opportunity to exhibit their talent in extra curriculur activities, Kesera said.

Preparations for the event are underway on a war-footing.

In the prelims on Sunday evening, over 5000 coaching students participated and enthralled the audience with performances such as reciting poems on social evils, gallantry of soldiers while others played the guitar and piano .

The second round of the prelims will be held on January 19.

Notably, the district administration has initiated several measures to release study stress and provide healthy and amusing environment to coaching students in Kota after the city witnessed a spate of suicides in 2015.

Over 1.75 lakh students from across the country are currently studying in the coaching institutes to crack entrance exams for admissions in prestigious engineering and medical colleges.

Title: Open garbage, dirty water: Khurbura residents cry for govt’s attention
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

Dehradun: Even as efforts are being made to make Dehradun a smart city, some areas continue to remain in miserable condition. The Khurbura area, one of the oldest localities in the city is one such location.

There is no door-to-door garbage collection facility in the area and locals do not have access to clean piped water. A spot visit by TOI revealed that loose and naked wires have become a threat for residents and hardly any development work reaches the area, which is cut off by Bindal river. Also, children working as labourers can easily be spotted here. “There isn’t any proper bridge for us to go to the other side to use public services. The temporary bridge breaks whenever it rains, and we get cut off from the rest of the city. Last year, a woman had to deliver her child without doctor’s assistance,” said Rajkumar Sahni, a local resident. He added that stench from garbage, lying in the open,has made many residents ill.

Locals also lament the fact that the state government does not give them attention as they are a migrant colony. Pooja Devi, who migrated to the city from Bihar around 20 years ago, told TOI, “We came here from Bihar for better job opportunities and better lifestyle. But moving here didn’t change things. Even after so many years, we are treated like outsiders here. Development of our locality isn’t a priority of any government.” She added that names of her family members are in the voter rolls but besides voting, they don’t get any government benefits.

Residents of Khurbura locality say that officials don’t take any concrete steps to address their woes despite several complaints. “There is no night shelter for the homeless, no medical facility for us. Those in power only make tall promises during elections,” said Abhishek, another local.

When asked to comment, Dehradun Municipal Corporation (DMC) officials claimed that all civic amenities are being provided in the locality. “Garbage was cleared from the locality a few days ago but it has got accumulated again. Soon, our garbage collection van would pick it up,” said Kailash Joshi, chief health officer of DMC.

Meanwhile, Khurbura ward councilor Vimla Gaur told TOI, “I tabled the proposal for construction of a proper bridge at DMC board meeting. The bridge will get installed very soon. As far as cleaning of Bindal river is concerned, the administration has assured me that they will take steps regarding that very soon.”

Title: BJP’s internal conflicts hitting governance: Khader
Content:
This story is from January 14, 2020

Mangaluru: Former minister and Mangaluru MLA U T Khader lashed out at the government for not convening the winter sessions of legislative assembly and legislative council, which are usually held in November or December.

While speaking to reporters here on Monday, the Congress leader also questioned the BJP government for not holding a joint session of the legislatures, which is customarily addressed by the governor in the first or second week of January every year.

“The whole administrative machinery is non-functional due to the internal conflicts of BJP. The party is busy with cabinet expansion and portfolio allocation to MLAs. People of the state are being forced to grin and bear it,” Khader said, and urged the government to hold the sessions immediately.

Taking chief minister B S Yediyurappa to task, Khader said the government has no confidence about its stability owing to internal issues. “Compensation has not been paid to those who have lost their property in the recent calamity. Beneficiaries of various housing schemes have not been given funds to complete the construction works. Those who have worked under National Rural Employment Guarantee Scheme have not been paid for their job, and so is the plight of ASHAs and other health workers. Don’t weaken the democratic set-up of the state by neglecting people,” Khader urged.

‘Clear air on survey’

Khader said he has directed DC Sindhu B Rupesh to issue a clarification with regard to recent instances wherein people refused to provide information during a door-to-door survey by ASHAs, health workers, anganwadi workers and election officials.

“People are apprehensive about the implementation of Citizens’ Amendment Act (CAA) and National Register of Citizens (NRC). An atmosphere of fear has gripped villagers with regard to CAA and NRC. Hence, I have asked the DC to issue a clarification stating that no data collection on CAA and NRC is being done in the district. I also appeal to people to cooperate with health workers and officials by giving them the required information being collected for government schemes and election purposes. The government should also should make it clear whether they have commenced any process related to CAA and NRC,” Khader said.

‘BJP is narrow-minded’

Calling the protest against the proposal to construct a 114-foot tall statue of Jesus Christ at Kapalabetta in Kanakapura shows the “narrow-mindedness of the party”, Khader said BJP should remember the contributions of Catholic institutions in India.

Title: Family suicide case: Youth in judicial custody
Content:
